Reviews.Content: Overall, I like the tablet. It is very fast and easy to use. However, at least once a day the tablet would freeze and have to be reset. Once it began buzzing like a phone that is on vibrate. I could not stop it from buzzing until I reset it. Big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: First one lasted a week-replacement lasted 2 days!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got the Le Pan II for a Christmas gift.  Loved it for a week and then it just crapped out!  Returned for a replacement, it crapped out after 2 days!  Returning it for a refund and will be looking for a different brand this time!  Definitely would NOT recommend!

Reviews.Title: Breaks quickly with normal use. Impossible to get warranty honored.
Reviews.Author: FlanMaster
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these, 1 month apart, for older children for school work and creativity exercises. At the same time of each purchase I bought special covers, cases, etc. to ensure maximum protection for these items.  Both units were handled carefully, used sparingly, and NEVER mishandled.  They were ALWAYS handled with care.  There were NEVER accidents with either unit.The power button ceased functioning (used to "click" when turning on, no longer clicks) and at the same time, we found during testing that the battery no longer held a charge. it could stay charging for days without a battery full sign.We called the customer service number from the manufacturer to see if some type of special reset could be attempted and we always got either a "we're closed" message or they would tell us to hold for 20 minutes and then disconnect at varying times.  the longest it kept us on hold was a little over 2 hours, but usually would disconnect us between 45 minutes to an hour.  We NEVER made it past the automated hold system.  We tried leaving a post via the manufacturer website but it would never accept the post on submission.The poor craftsmanship and complete lack of customer service doesn't even warrant a single star.  The unit will function sufficiently for the limited time it works but if you are expecting a unit that will last more than a month or few, then look elsewhere.  This unit is a waste of money.We are still trying to get resolution after weeks of fruitless effort and have never successfully managed communication with the manufacturer.  We have turned to Amazon and are trying to get them to provide assistance and are still waiting a follow up call from them as of this writing.

Reviews.Title: Purchased Aug 30th 2012, Power Issue Jan 7th - No Answer at Service Phone
Reviews.Author: Reko Ponton
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Tablet on Aug 30th and have had more than a few issues with maintaining wireless connectivity. But since all I needed to do was turn off wireless and then turn it back on I was going to be OK with that.But now it would not power on no matter if I had it plugged in or not. I tried resetting it but that didn't work.  Then after about 6 hours I tried again and it powered on.  I checked my eMail, facebook and then set it down.  After a couple of hours I tried to use it and it wouldn't power on again.  A few hours later it did power on but I couldn't get it to connect to a wireless connection at my house.I called the Service Phone number provided on the website for Support and was hold hold for, no kidding, 1 Hour and 44 Minutes THEN I was hung up on. I realize I'm the idiot who sat on hold for an hours and 44 minutes but I kept telling myself "I've invested this much time, I may as well stay on" and " This thing did cost me almost $300.00.I'm really disappointed in this tablet and in the lack of customer support.I hope they answer my eMail.-Reko

Reviews.Title: A Christmas gift to me from me.
Reviews.Author: Careful Shopper
Reviews.Content: Great price on Amazon Flash Deal sale. Very long battery life, excellent display. The voice recognition capture makes no errors. This little tablet does everything I need a tablet to do.

Reviews.Title: More than happy....
Reviews.Author: Robyn Swaim "robynthetexasvamp"
Reviews.Content: I considered getting a tablet for a while, but have never been someone who rushes into the "latest fad" in electronics.  Last December I saw my kids at Christmas and my DIL had an iPad2.  It was nice, but way too pricey for me, however I did like the features it offered and was looking for something similar without the proprietary connections Apple requires.  After much reading and learning, I stumbled upon the Le Pan II.  It seemed to have everything I wanted without the huge cash outlay required by some other manufacturers.I ordered mine March 9th and received it April 2nd.  I've waited to write a review to give myself time to familiarize myself with most of the things that can be done with this tablet.  So far I have used Gmail, Hotmail, YouTube, Twitter, Skype, Facebook, several games (Pirates Of The Caribbean - Master of the Seas, AirAttack, TV and Movie trivia games, etc), Flixster, Regal, Google World and at least two drawing apps plus numerous other miscellaneous apps which are available for free.  I've downloaded apps from getjar, Google Play and the Amazon Android market.  I've changed the wallpaper, created, configured and changed my notification ringtone from a MP3 file.  I've listened to music, radio and police/fire scanners and used the GPS module.  I've formatted and installed two different 32gb microSD cards with no problems and transferred data (music and photos) again with no problems.In other words I think I have tried and tested just about every thing this tablet has to offer.  All with few to no problems (had one small problem with a Hotmail app, but I changed it to an older version and have had no other problems except my lack of tablet experience).  I've connected to 3 different wifi routers (home and two more on the go).I also contacted the Le Pan support site.  Emailed them from their website over a weekend (on a Sunday), received a reply Monday morning.  Request was filled within two days (I ordered an extra USB cable and charger plug).  I received them today (April 17) and they even sent me an extra wrist strap at no extra charge.  No issues with the tablet which required any further support.I got a CaseCrown black tablet case (currently unavailable) as well as a soft-sided sleeve from Disney and the Armorsuit screen protectorArmorSuit MilitaryShield - Le Pan II Screen Protector Shield with Lifetime Replacements. It protects the screen from scratches and minimizes the fingerprints as well as making it easier to wipe them off when they do occur.Tablet feels solid, well-built, sturdy and between many of the reviews and posts here, as well as YouTube, and the Lepanlife forum, plus a friend I made via the review comments if I had a question I found the answer in short order.  A huge thank you to all those who took the time to write lengthy reviews about this tablet and post videos.My tablet came with Baseband v.118 which appears to have solved most of the problems people had in the past.  The only thing I haven't tried yet is Bluetooth because I do not have any Bluetooth accessories to test.  Frankly, the keyboard (while it does take a little getting used to) is adequate for typing.  No, I cannot type as fast on it as I would a full size keyboard, but it's good enough for now.  At some point I may get one with Bluetooth, but for now I couldn't be happier.  I got everything I wanted for almost half the cost of a similarly configured tablet and mine has (basically) unlimited storage capabilities via the 32gb microSD cards.  If I need more storage, I just buy another card.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II
Reviews.Author: John Vernon Eckert Jr
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome tablet! Solid, reliable, easy to use, has numerous connections.  This is the real Crapple $pad killer.  You will be impressed with this tablet and you will not have to spend a small fortune like you would with an I pad (junk).  Under $300 with an extra 32 GB micro SD card. True built-in GPS with no external antenna needed works flawlessly! LOVE IT!!!A+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet But. . . . . . . . . .
Reviews.Author: Y-Not "John"
Reviews.Content: I love "the Pan" tablet 2.  The wifi works great at my house running N wireless and encryption wpa2.......But I do have trouble connecting at some other locations - I'd normally attribute that to the local site but I can connect with my smart phone every time.  Don't know what's going on with that.Also not a big fan of the proprietary 30 pin to usb cable.  No HDMI output cable available yet - kinda stinks.Overall the tablet is fast with bright clear screen and streams netflix very smoothly.  Finger prints could bug some of you they don't really bother me and I rarely notice them - that is probably true of most tabs but no biggy for me.  I have read many complaints re netflix streaming and here is a word of caution.  If you have N wireless and add any G wireless item to the router the entire network will drop to G speed.  This is true of many of the smart TVs on the market.  dropping to G speeds could cause netflix to buffer excessively.  I only allow N wireless to connect with my network.It does have the android market - I guess they call it Google Play now.  Pretty good deal for $275 with free ship and no sales tax.It would be an easy 5 of 5 if the wifi was more dependable and the hdmi out cable was available.  Hope there will be an upgrade to ice cream sandwich - don't know.

Reviews.Title: probably the best alternative for ipad under $300
Reviews.Author: Le Pan II
Reviews.Content: I am gonna start this review but saying that this was my first ever tablet. I was looking to get a tablet under $300 because the new ipad was out of my budget and I did tons of research and based on other reviews,this was the best tablet in my price range. I was skeptical at first to buy le pan because I had never heard of them before but after using the tablet for couple of weeks now, I can assure you that this product is really well built. It feels very solid/sturdy and you wouldn't expect such a fine product for low price range. Based on the reviews, many people were having issue with wifi but personally, I have had absolutely no problem with that. I have played with my friends' Ipad before and this feels no different than that. Its just your preference between Droid and apple. I have been using driod phone about a year and I love Droid better than iPhone or another apple product. This has a big screen and it is perfect to watch movies or surf the browser. It has a fast processor which is perfect for playing games. The screen resolution far exceeded my expectation. If you are looking for a tablet under $300, look no further. You will love this 10 (9.7 precisely)  inch bad boy.

Reviews.Title: Well worth it
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Davis "DigitalSage"
Reviews.Content: This product is from an unknown company (at least, unknown to those who have not purchased this device), but I don't expect that to last.  This product is well worth the purchase, unless you have misgivings about the lack of peripherals/add ons.I would encourage you to read the postings at [...] before purchase.You can find accessories that work on the market, but aren't advertised for the Le Pan II.  For example:Logitech Tablet Keyboard for Android 3.0+ (920-003390) works perfectly.Targus Truss Case/Stand for HP TouchPad - THZ07202US (Black/Gray) fits the Le Pan II perfectly.Apple (iPhone/iPad) 30-pin cables work as USB cords, though you have to perform minor surgery to get them to dock with the device.  See [...]That's really my only negative about this device -- the connector on the cable that ships with it is delicate and will not survive a moderate impact with torque (the plug comes apart).  I now use the cables for my iTouch to power both the Le Pan and the iTouch with the same cable, after performing the VERY minor surgery explained in the link above.The only other major complaint you will hear is that it isn't compatible with Ice Cream Sandwich / Android 4 yet.  If this is a major consideration for you, you will probably want to look elsewhere or prepare to wait.If you have concerns about who is the product vendor, the company name is Matsunichi and they are based in Hong Kong, China.  If you take the information on their web site at face value, they seem to have a firmly established product and customer base in China.[...]Still no complains to this point (4/7/12), other than the fragile USB cable that I broke and had to replace with the iPod cable surgery.

Reviews.Title: Blew my expectations out of the water!
Reviews.Author: dkreichstag
Reviews.Content: So I had been looking for a good tablet for months then I came across this random off brand called Le Pan and the reviews were pretty darn good but there were certainly some concerning ones as well.  After looking some more I finally gave this product a chance and have had it for almost a month now.  It blew my mind and continues to daily.  Here are my likes and dislikes about the tablet.Likes:- Smooth, everything runs great and the programs load quickly- Sound, the sound quality is really quite good keeping in mind that it's not my home theater system- Screen, the quality is great and watching HD movies is like a dream- Build, it is a very solid build with a good feel, the buttons are well built and not loose like people are saying- Memory, there is already an 8GB internal but unlike most tablets it can have up to 32 GB external which is awesomeDislikes:- Camera, it's not terrible but it is just 2mp but it gets the job done- fingerprints, they aren't the worst but just spend the extra 8 bucks and get a fingerprint and anti-glare cover

Reviews.Title: Tablet was D.O.A.
Reviews.Author: PrettyMuch
Reviews.Content: I was ecstatic about this product and their reviews (not to mention the price!) but...Pretty much no pros on the product because the entire tablet screen was non-responsive. After doing a hard reset, then a factory reset, nothing I did would make the tablet recognize my taps, touches, swipes...etc. I did contact a forum of users with the tablet... They were pretty well-informed, nice and helpful. The customer service at le pan couldn't tell me anything I didn't already know but did respond within 24 hours. I will not be buying a new one because it took forever for amazon to even ship this product (and it's would-be replacement, which I cancelled after fear of getting a product that may break again down the line and I'd be stuck with after the return warranty). I will also not be dealing with le pan because they will not release the firmware which I am told they are legally obligated to do according with their license with google. The effect being that the end-user cannot modify or improve their own purchased property (without great expertise and difficulty).Long story short... I was hopeful about this product but ultimately very unhappy

Reviews.Title: My first tablet and choosing the right one
Reviews.Author: Paul Bonaddio(Castropa531) "PrB"
Reviews.Content: I received my Le Pan II 5 days ago and overall I'm very pleased with it.  First off, the experience is different then the iPad,  the iPad has a very, very refined UI, the Honeycomb 3.2.1 that ships with the Le Pan II is good but still needs some refinement if it wants to have the user experience like the Apple. What's the difference?  It doesn't have the fluidity of the iPad-screen orientation, swipes or the near instant response time.  What's in the Le Pan II favor? everything else.  I get to choose where everything goes on the screen, the background all this makes it feel like it's made for me.  Also, I get to browse the web like it was supposed to be browsed.  You can choose between the mobile or full version of webpages.It plays games very well!  The Android storefront is very nice and I think easier then iTunes for searching for stuff to download.  The LePan II is slow on my WiFi, I've been looking in the forms and most of the people on there think it's because of the router one uses at their home.  I use the Cisco-Linksys E2000 Advanced Wireless-N Router at home with WPA2-PSK and AES encryption.  The forms say it likes open or last generation router security features.  I still connect fine, it's just about half the speed of everything else in my home.I also have minor backlight bleeding in the bottom right and left corners- not distracted for about 90% of the time. Only really noticeable on dark backgrounds.  My solution, don't have dark backgrounds!  the IPS display its self is very nice, great colors and wide viewing angles and bright.The Snapdragon dual core proc with Adreno 220 is plenty fast.  I think it's even faster the the Terga2 chips that everything else ships with.  I like the iPad like sceen size and shape a lot, I'm not a fan of the 16:9 form factor.The HP Touchpad cases fit it and are at bargain prices.  I got this one Targus Truss Case/Stand for HP TouchPad - THZ07202US (Black/Gray)  And ArmorSuit MilitaryShield - Le Pan II Black Carbon Fiber Film Protector Shield + Screen Protector with Lifetime Replacements And Samsung 16GB Class 10 MicroSDHC High Speed Memory Card with Komputerbay SD adaptor and High Speed USB ReaderThe items above gave me a complete set-up, great looks and performance.All in all, I would recommend the Le Pan II as a wise choice for the price, features and performance so much so I have ordered another one-it's on back order of course:)Update 8/12/12I installed ICS and wow what an improvement.  The update process took time to do it right but follow the directions on the Le Pan website and it goes as expected.  It took about 10 minutes total and I'm very happy with the outcome.  All issues with WIFI re gone.  This little tablet now flies on WIFI,  no more buffering on youtube and Netflix.  I really enjoy it and can't wait to see what the come out with next!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Dharmesh Patel
Reviews.Content: I like the speed and gestures. Touch screen is very good and comparable to iPad. Little heavier than my iPad....Perfect for the price though.

Reviews.Title: update your firmware
Reviews.Author: S. A. French
Reviews.Content: update 8-2-2012 over seven months now and works perfectly. My wife loves it and is planning on taking it with her to the hospital when she goes in to have our daughter.**update as of 5-25-2012. still works perfectly after 5 months. A word to the wise, if you are not smart enough to update your firmware just buy the most expensive "new ipad" you can find and stop writing reviews displaying your ignorance. **I give the lepan tc970 5 stars because of quality and functionality vs value. First of all, I got this tablet for my wife for christmas so we have had plenty of time to get a very good feel for it. Secondly, between my wife, myself and my 4 year old son this tablet gets used on average about 5 hours a day. It comes pre installed with official android market aka (google play) and adobe flash player(It also upgraded to the newest version through the market). The build quality is excellent, it looks and feels like a brand name device. We use it as a daily driver and I find it to be nicer than my cousins Ipad 1. It is mostly the little things like I HATE typing in stuff. We talk to our phones, we talk to our xbox 360 and we talk to our tablet. Today we were at a family birthday party and While holding my 1 year old I came to the realization that it is very annoying to have to try and type on her ipad with 1 hand like a caveman to do a simple google or youtube search rather than just press the mic button and speak what we want to search for, and THEN the ipads browser brings up what appears to be a "youtube app" like on a phone rather than the actual website like our laptop and our lepan do. I Know several people with ipad 1-2,new Ipod touch, hp touchpad and other android tablets so I have had lots of time to play with them all to my hearts content. The physical build quality of the lepan is on par with those tablets. It plays angry birds, netflix, hbo go, crackle, skype video chat(more about that in the cons), facebook, youtube(it plays most of these both in the browser or as an app, except netflix which requires silverlight for in browser playback). The only game I found that it wasn't fast enough to play flawlessly was gta3, which it plays but with hesitation and not perfectly smooth(I have made it to the second part of the city after they reopen the broken bridge). Pretty much it does what you would expect a full fledged tablet to do.CONS ..all of these are well documented and fairly common..REGARDING THE FREEZING EVERYONE IS TALKING ABOUT....(as well as a couple other things)The few problems the tablet has are obviously related to minor bugs in the firmware which could potentially be fixed with a simple update once it's available from lepan(they have released 3 updates since we have had it so at least they are supporting it).1. It didn't take me long to figure out that(at least in my case) the tablet didn't like us to let it's screen go to sleep ON ITS OWN while it was in the middle of STREAMING OR DOWNLOADING VIA WIFI. It froze once while streaming pandora and once while downloading the extra game content for gta3(both times it froze the exact instant that the screen went to sleep). To remedy this I simply set the screen sleep timer in settings to the highest value(30 min i think) and when we are done using the tablet we put it to sleep manually by pressing the power button. We have not found this to be a hassle because it kind of comes naturally to turn a device off when you are done using it. ........Since we have done this we have had no more problems whatsoever with the tablet freezing........(I did this about 2 months ago)*****edit. we are currently using update build number 4626 and today I tested it according to c.s. instructions in the tablet page discussions and even after turning the screen sleep timer back down I could not get it to freeze again. This morning I asked my wife when the last time was that it froze on her and she said it has never froze while she was using it. It has also never froze on my son, so apparently it only happened to me the couple times when we first got it and I was downloading alot of apps and games and setting everything up. I don't know if it was the 4626 update that permanently fixed it or what but I do know that I have been trying to get it to freeze on purpose and can't get it to do it again.*****2. Skype video chat works perfectly with the skype app that is available on the market BUT the first time you run it the screen will flicker strangely, leave the video call running and toggle the video on and off in between flickers, after doing this a couple times(may take around 30 seconds) it will find the right video settings and work properly. This only needs done the one time(unless you flash a new firmware or do a factory reset) Every time you use skype video after this it will work perfectly as expected. I skyped with both a new Ipod touch and a ipad 2, both worked flawlessly on both ends.3. This is not a big deal but I figured I would mention it anyway. With the stock launcher, the home screens don't auto rotate like they should. It rotates properly in apps and on the web, but not on the home screens. However it works properly when I run "go launcher ex" which is free on the market and I figure most people would want to run a fancy custom launcher regardless. (I didn't even notice the rotation issue until later because I had already planned to run go launcher before we even got it.)So that is it, if you can't or don't want to spend more than $200, this is the way to go. There is a reason that the tc970 has such high reviews on every site that sells it. It's because it's an excellent device with a beautiful screen, long battery life, pleasing on the eyes design wise, and does every single thing that you would expect of a tablet. You could condemn it for having a couple easily fixable superficial flaws or with a little tlc you could absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Good Price Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Bagpiper
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for over a month and used it heavily. To be honest the quality of the build is high the manufacture used good quality for a china tab. I am a heavy user of video and internet this tab is basically my PC. My frustration started on the 1st day with the tablet it would constantly freeze not to be confused with a forceclose. I would be using the tablet and it would just freeze constant using multiple different applications. So I contacted the tech support and they where fast in their response. They advised me to update my firmware which I did immediately to version 4431. After the firmware update I am still having issue but now the tablet also freezes when it when it go to sleep mode. Again I place a support ticket the IT support advised me to turn on USB debugging under development and to select an option called leave on while charging. It still freezes to the point I have to press the reset button 3-5 times a day. This is not my 1st tablet and I am not new to Android this tablet is a paper weight. I will not recommend this tablet to anyone, which is sad because this is a great unit and there is no reason it has these issues. I did some research on this tablet and this seems to be a common issue. Please do your research on this tablet I am going to try the Lepan TC970 II I hope the next Lepan will not be a regret.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Sherene Long "lovechild"
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative to the Ipad if u are looking for less expensive.  The android market is just as good as the Apple store and my songs are downloaded for a lot less and free in most cases and same grat apps.  It is easy to copy songs from my PC onto to tablet.  It works straight out the box just connect to WI FI and go.  Youtube is fast, movies show great and I can skype!! Takes pretty good pics and video.  I love this thing!!

Reviews.Title: Le Pan--What a Steal!!!
Reviews.Author: GTDfan
Reviews.Content: After playing with the device for a month, I have become a huge fan of Le Pan.  It satisfies my needs for a tablet.  I hope this company keeps producing quality products at affordable prices.* Le Pan fits my budget of $200.* Le Pan has a 9.7-inch screen.  7-inch screen is just too small for me.* Le Pan is aesthetically pleasing.Thank you, Smiles321, for recommending "CaseCrown Preppy Horizontal Flip Cotton Weave Organizer Portfolio Style Case (Black) for the Apple iPad Wifi / 3G Model 16GB, 32GB, 64GB".  It's another steal ($5.00 including shipping) in addition to my precious Le Pan.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy build quality, would buy over the ipad, everytime
Reviews.Author: PKI
Reviews.Content: Bought after over 2 months of tablet research, sequence of several tests on different brands and makes at BestBuy, and very heavy focus on application compatibility for 'preemptive' estimation of upgrades/usability.Top reasons for buying:1) Front camera2) Value for money3) Online reviews4) Tests/experiments with other units viz..n00k, k!ndle F!re, Ip@d, s@m$ung G@laxy tab, etcPleasant surprises upon delivery:1) Build quality2) Touch screen responsiveness3) LCD resolutionNot-so-pleasant surprises:1) Weight2) Buggy apps for Android 2.2(not a Le Pan issue)3) Wi-Fi radio strength4) GPS dependent on internet (since its based on google maps navigation, not on the Unified GPS platform used on car GPS devices)*** I refuse to compare this unit with the iPad, since the business model and integration of the 2 are very different ***Ipads are indigenously built by Apple - Software to Hardware to packagingThe android platform is different, since the software is developed by Google (Kudos!), and they have made it so any manufacturer could port it onto a mobile device meeting the minimum hardware requirements. This in itself, is a commendable design, unlike the AppleIOS, which frankly goes bonkers if exposed to unknown hardware. The Android platform handles different hardware  makes pretty  splendidly, obviously with some quirks, as anticipated with any open source software platform.Point is, evaluation of android tablets should be distinct, in that, the hardware and software should be compared separately.Hardware  SoftwareSuperb build quality  Gels beautifully with the Le Pan HardwareChiseled shape, sits well on the palm  Impressively fastSlightly heavy for a wrist pivot over long duration  Buggy versions of apps for 2.2(ex-skype)Power button needs getting used to, not complaint-worthy tho  Incompatible with GoogleHangouts(2.3 onwards works)Brilliant touch screen resolution and responsiveness  Secondary memory read/write is faster than expected4.5 stars to Le Pan for the hardware  3.5 stars to Google for Android 2.2 (4.5 for Honeycomb)Synopsis - Le Pan has a winner here. I paid around $200 for this unit, which is a steal, and I would strongly recommend buying the Le Pan II with 8gigs of internal memory, so you can install more 'frequently used apps' locally, for even faster response.That said, I am delighted to have purchased this unit for $200, and would buy another Le Pan too.PS - If you are not comfortable with upgrading on the android platform, get help from xdadevelopers, but do not get deterred. The Android OS is superior in architecture, and unless you are willing to be hostage to Apple's barricaded eco-system, you are better off with an Android mobile deviceRecommended improvements:1) Newer android version on factory build (Le Pan II has it)2) Changing mic placement to front panel (for better audio feed during video chat)3) Ultra low profile power button, with inward inundation to avoid accidental brush/touch.

Reviews.Title: I was hesitant but so far so good.
Reviews.Author: KTrain
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy a Le Pan tablet because of it being a brand I've never heard of and it running android 2.2 (froyo).  I was a bit worried about it feeling outdated and about some things I had read that you had to fiddle with it to get Netflix working and about launchers not showing up in the android market for some reason.  Another reason I was hesitant is some of the reviews have indicated bad wifi strength and problems getting/staying connected to their wifi.  Lastly I was worried (and still am a bit) about the reviews stating their tablets had freezing/dying problems.Well so far, NONE of these have been issues with my unit.  I updated using the steps on the Le Pan website (lepantab(dot)com).  I logged into the android market and Amazon Appstore without issue.  I haven't found an app yet that won't run.  Netflix works perfectly. My wifi signal (using WPA2 encryption) is great and stays connected. Running froyo hasn't been an issue for me other than looking a bit dated in the menues/notification bar.  I got ADW launcher running as a home replacement so I could fit more icons on one screen (the default looks kinda goofy with the icons so spread out in my opinion).Most of all, the screen is BEAUTIFUL and very responsive/sensitive.  I have had several people ask how much it costs and get a  surpised look when I tell them I got it for such a low price.  The screen and overall build quality does not look "budget" at all.This tablet easily gets a 5/5 so far from me.My only complaints about it so far are 1. the proprietary usb/charging cable.  I hate proprietary connectors and wish this could just have a micro or mini usb port.  2. An upgrade to honeycomb would be nice but I knew about it not getting updated before I ordered mine so I can't complain too much.  So far froyo has been fine.Based on my own experiences, I would definitely recommend this tablet to others.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: jstd
Reviews.Content: I love the 10" screen compared to the 7".  I also thought it was very responsive to touch and was faster than I expected.  I charged it fully as reviews had suggested and had no problem getting started after that.  I used an iPad before, but found this pretty easy to understand.  I'd recommend it for everyday activities--the screen is really nice and it operates well.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade firmware on Le Pan Website = BEST TABLET

Reviews.Title: I think SOME units require a FULL 8 hr charge BEFORE 1st Use... Don't give up!
Reviews.Author: The Graphite Girl
Reviews.Content: Hey y'all...My unit wouldn't do a thing EXCEPT display a battery charging for the 5 or 6 hrs i charged it.  I returned it and THEN read from some folks they had to FULLY CHARGE before it would start up, but once it did, it worked thereafter with NO incident.I saw most of the reviews said "worked straight out of the box, so i panicked and returned it, but maybe that 6800 ma battery on some units needs that 8 hr conditioning BEFORE 1 st use (it says to FULLY CHARGE in the manual, but NOT in the Quick Start Guide and i dint see that till AFTER i returned it)Plus some people in the forum said theirs was like that, so don't give up (like i did : )But make no mistake, this (from just the handling of it since it wouldn't turn on for me : ) is an awesome unit, design is P-E-R-F-E-C-T!Hope this is the case and helps someone who thinks their unit is D.O.A....TGG***UPDATE****Got a replacement from W**mart, free shipping, arrived in a day & a half (on a Saturday Fed Ex no less : )  Love this tablet....

Reviews.Title: Great Tab for the Price
Reviews.Author: mlm081375
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a Big Screen well Lit and easy to use tab for my girlfriends father who has a hard time seeing. We did a lot of research and finally figured for the price we would give this one a go, and glad we did. We got it for him for an early christmas present, when it arrived, I being kind of a tech nut, decided I was going to load it with all of the programs from AM that he would use, and we fell in love with it. The screen is huge, and very forgiving in most light as well as viewing angles. The Tab is very easy to use and is very forgiving for people who are not very technical. We were so pleased with the purchase we bought one for ourselves 2 days later. For the price you cannot beat this tab. Wish it came with the newer version of Android OS but it works, its stable, and thats all that matters.

Reviews.Author: DJMillz "Nic"

On par with $500+ tabs for half the price. Streams netflix great, pictures look great, expandable memory up to 32gb with a micro sd card (neither galaxy or ipad offer the expandable memory slot). If you're considering not buying because of the name, don't hesitate. All the stuff gets made in asia anyway lol. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Big screen, fast..recommended

The technology of this tablet is truely " you get what you pay for". the only reason i  haven't returned it is because i only got it to show my pictures when i have clients who want to see my photography work so it displays pictures well and i sometimes browse the internet, so for the price if thats all i need then its good enough to get by, but if i knew then what i know now i wouldn't have bought this, even if it were for $75 dollars. especially now that i see what others who gave reviews tried to warn me of, it doesn't turn off, you hit the off button and it shuts off at that moment,but when you come back the next day to turn it on,  it's already on, it just  turns itself on and goes into sleep mode and you think that it was off. poor quality !!!

It would get on the internet once but you could not navigate to another page unless you turned off the tablet completely and then started it up. Don't waste your money.  Customer service is awful.

Reviews.Title: le pan ll 4.0.4 i.c.s. - buggy at first, performed factory reset and now working fine
Reviews.Author: michael duvall
Reviews.Content: About me: windows "power user" with 13+ years pc and 6+ years computer programming experience. Most of my friends come to me with their PC problems. I have used other tablets before, first-time using android.About the let pan ll: at first, the tablet gave errors when trying to download apps from Google play store, was unable to install adobe flash player, and was generally very buggy. After "googling" for answers and not finding any, i finally gave up and performed a factory reset. After the reset, everything worked fine and I have not had any problems at all since then. I noticed that some apparent 3rd-party apps were missing after the reset. I assume these were installed at the factory and were the causes of the problems.After sorting-out the issues, I am very happy with the tablet. The build quality feels solid, and battery life is very good. The battery will last for about 7-8 hours of constant use with mixed web surfing, game play, etc. If not used for gaming, a single charge will last for 2+ days. I would recommend this tablet to anyone looking for an affordable android tablet.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother...freezes up!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this product from another supplier (ok, I was sucked in by network shopping channel and failed to do my research prior to purchasing).  I wanted to surprise my sister with a tablet, and decided to put it through the paces before sending it to her. I have owned a 7" Samsung tablet for over a year, and wanted to compare the two products.  After 2 days of playing on LePan, as well as sharing it with coworkers, I am packing it up and returning it.  The tablet regularly freezes up and requires "resetting".  Really?  This is necessary in 2013? I can't diagnose the cause, other than this product is garbage.In addition to not working, it has a terrible design.  The on/off buttons and the volume buttons have such a minimal profile on the edge, that it is difficult to turn the tablet on/off, and nearly impossible to change the volume.  You have to turn up the lights, turn the tablet on its side, and search for the buttons. The volume control in particular is just plain stupid (invisible buttons are never a good idea in my opinion).  And an amusing note...the LePan Quick Start Guide Instructions for starting the product:  "Press the power button for seconds"????  That was my first clue that I was not going to like LePan.  I recently updated the software on my Samsung tablet and the interface is now identical to my Samsung S4 phone..sweet!  Samsung knows how to design, support and sell electronics. Save your money and invest in a proven product like Samsung (or product of your choice other than LePan).

I have also downloaded some of my Kindle books on it, and the reader works great.  It is a great value, about $100 cheaper than the Kindle Fire 10" screen, and it works just as good.

Reviews.Title: ease of use
Reviews.Author: dominic deduonni
Reviews.Content: for my grand kids they love it,they love the way they can down load new games and search the web

Updating to ICS took a couple of tries, but is now completed and system operates with no hiccups.  Use this tablet mainly when on road trips and for the GPS function.  Sits in the car hooked to an inverter when at home....and sitting in a car in the hot Texas sun hasn't caused any problems or issues.Sorry that other people have had problems.......I paid about $100.00 more for mine that the going price now.  Had I watched I would have bought my wife one of these instead of the stinking Kindle (I don't like them, but she seems to be happy with it).Anyway, thats my two cents worth.

Reviews.Title: great option

Reviews.Title: Great tablet. Simple and Effective
Reviews.Author: Tim "Timdiana" Dunn
Reviews.Content: As tablets go, this one seems simple enough; but that's not to say that's a bad thing. In fact this is great one to have. It is easy to use and its wi-fi abilities are fantastic. I recommend getting something like a New 32gb Micro Sd Card Sdhc Tf Flash Memory Card 32gb Class 10, New! Usa!. I find that works the best. In any case, I would recommend getting this tablet. It is good one to have.

Reviews.Title: I can't kill this thing!
Reviews.Author: SPLEclipse
Reviews.Content: I bought the Le Pan 970 about 2 years ago because (a) it was on sale and (b) it packs a TON of features that I need. This wasn't going to be for average use, I installed it in my car as a music player, GPS, and on occasion digital gauge display for MPH/fuel economy/engine temp/etc. I have it connected to a generic 2A USB charge that is triggered with the key. I use Tasker to control the system by telling it when to sleep/wake up and when the screen should remain on/off. It is subject to severe hot and cold weather, vibration, and is often left for days (sometimes well over a week) in a sleep state with literally no problems at all. It refuses to die or malfunction in any way whatsoever, even without being reset or turned off for months at a time.The pluses: GPS works great even in bad weather and inside the car. Bluetooth is very stable and connects to my OBDII dongle every time if need be (I have another tablet that handles the gauges 99% of the time, but this serves as a backup). Screen is excellent even in direct sunlight. Even after days on standby the battery never drops below 50%, and quickly charges up even with the screen on full-time and max brightness. Refuses to malfunction or shut-off without my prompting.The negatives: No Android updates from the manufacturer. Limited aftermarket ROMs. No USB hosting (that I'm aware of). The processor is considered dated, and I have run into stuttering audio while trying to run intensive programs in tandem, although I've only had this happen while trying to run Co-Pilot as my navigation. I switched to Sygic and the problem stopped completely. The camera is rough at best, and the built-in speakers are headache inducing at anything but low volume, although these are common problems with any tablet in this price range and of this age.I've used several different tablets in my car (Nook Color running various flavors of CM, MID a81e, Lenovo a2107), and because they've all been on the "budget" side of things none of them except for the Le Pan have performed very well. The 970 has not only performed well in terms of performance and stability but gone above-and-beyond my wildest dreams in terms of sheer longevity and tenaciousness.

Reviews.Title: worked for maybe 1  year

Reviews.Title: Le Pan ll 9.7"
Reviews.Author: Terry McAlister
Reviews.Content: I have spent several weeks researching and trying to decide whether to get a IPad or a tablet.  Finally because the price was so much better I ordered the tablet.  I am so glad that I did, I am very pleased with the Le Pan ll and I have yet to find anything wrong with it.  I can still read my yahoo mail and I have access to the same games that I played on my laptop.  I would order this product all over again.

Reviews.Title: Best affordable Tablet out there.... Hands down!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my girlfriend a Galaxy Tab 2, which is an amazing tablet. I used hers a few times and decided that I wanted a tablet too, but did not want to spend another $350 dollars. I started to search for reviews of cheaper tablets and ran across this LePan 2 tablet. Decided to give it a try. I am very pleased. It does everything that her Galaxy Tab does. Just as quickly and flawlessly, I might add. Her and I sat side by side and loaded the same videos and programs at exactly the same time.. There was little to no difference in the speed. Other than small very small differences in picture quality, I find this tablet very comparable to the Galaxy Tab 2. The picture quality is excellent and HD. Just when comparing it to the Galaxy Tab, side by side, The Galaxy picture is a little sharper, but I think I only noticed because I had them side by side with the exact same video playing. It loads youtube, netflix, HBO Go and any other video from any other site that I have tried flawlessly without lag. The battery life is great and the tablet speed is great. This tablet is easily comparable to tablets well out of its price range. I know that many of the reviews on here talk of issues upgrading the software. I did not have this issue, but mine was already upgraded when I purchased it, so I cannot speak of the ease or difficulty of this action, but I would recommend this tablet to anyone. If I had to complain at all, which I am just knit picking by saying this. The power button is a little small and while the sound quality is good, I wish the speakers were on the front like they are on the Galaxy Tab. These are very tolerable issues, but worthy of mention.

Reviews.Title: totally awesome
Reviews.Author: antdog02
Reviews.Content: I ordered two le pan 2 tablets on the 2nd and I received them today 4th of April(amazon has AWESOME delivery!!!). First I promptly put on the screen savers from POSRUS on both tablets and soon after was setting up Gmail,email, documents to go for my microsoft word files, and my powerpoint documents Netflix,crackle, you name it I downloaded it. Everything was so easy to accomplish with this tablet that I was up and running in an hour. I installed a Sandisk 32g microsd card and seemlessly transferred documents from the le pan 2 to the micro SD card using the app file manager (just copy and paste to where you want it to go). My wife also loves her Le pan 2 and can't put it down. The display is absolutely beautiful and I can't wait to watch HD movies on it. If you are wondering whether to buy this tablet do not hesitate to jump in with both feet. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: le pan II
Reviews.Author: James McCutcheon
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Fast and easy to use.  Did have a problem downloading anything on Google play.  Went to Let Pan website and sent email.  Once they returned my email telling me to reset to factory settings everything works great.

Reviews.Title: Its Better than top priced tablets!

Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this purchase. The preformance is excellent and the graphics are amazing. The main thing I was looking for was Bluetooth connection and it's one of the only ones I saw that had it. Has google play and also allows you to add other android apps from connected pc's or whatever. The price was the real show stopper. My friends 500 dollar samsung doesnt have the features this has. She is jelous lol. I am happy so far had it 2 weeks.

I have followed each step it won't work for me. However I did install another player which works just as good. I am still happy with it. The only bad part is you can't install hulu. Reviews.Title: Power Button Malfunctions
Reviews.Author: anon
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift, and fell in love with it, only to have it start "glitching" out on me within 2 months of owning it. I had even gotten to the point where I was using it as an alarm clock. Last night, the power button stopped working... In order to get the screen to light up, I have to plug it into the charger (just to wake it up!). Overall, I'd say it has a pretty decent OS--Android Ice Cream Sandwich is a cute name and pretty user friendly-- but the hardware is terrible. (I researched this tablet after I discovered the power button was malfunctioning. Apparently, this is a common problem with this device. Beware..... you'll fall in love, only to have your heart's power button malfunction.)

Reviews.Title: Ghost in the Machine
Reviews.Author: Oofah32
Reviews.Content: Update:  Amazon exchanged product and honored the price.  They are great to deal with and the tablet is working really well.  No more ghost in the machine.I was awakened in the middle of the night when the gadget just went on out of the blue.  I turned it off, it went on.  I turned it off, but it had other ideas...still does.  Freaky!

Reviews.Title: Worst purchase I ever made!
Reviews.Author: Troy67
Reviews.Content: I bought a LePan II in April 2012. Six months later it stopped booting up when I pressed the power button. Returned the tablet and 8 weeks and multiple hours on the phone trying to contact product support, received a replacement. It's been 6 months and the replacement crapped out just like the original. Do not buy any LePan products, you'll regret it.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Thomas Peter Denning
Reviews.Content: Yo cannot beat this tablet for the price.  I bought this for my wife as a Christmas present and she loves it!

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II 9.7"
Reviews.Author: Jose Carrera
Reviews.Content: Exceptional tablet, Let's start with the screen great display HD And the speed is unbelievable as fast as my laptop. I really like it has a safety line that prevents my daughter from damaging If she dropped it. It also has a two megapixel camera and it has wonderful reaction, there's  nothing to say I don't like about this tablet. I highly recommended for all ages.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: middlebrooks
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT, ITS LIKE A LITTLE MINI SIZE FLAT SCFREEN TV. VERY FUNCTIONAL FOR EVERYDAY USEE! IT ALLOWS YOU TO BE COMFORTABLE IN BED AND SURFING THE NET. THIS IS A GREAT TABLET!

Reviews.Title: Right from 1st week, the ON/OFF switch never worked :) and need to reset
Reviews.Author: Neel Deshpande "Neel"
Reviews.Content: Right from 1st week, the ON/OFF switch never worked :) and I had to use RESET. SO many times this was hanging. I am not sure how such poor quality products are made and sold.Never buy this

Reviews.Title: Great bargain
Reviews.Author: Susi
Reviews.Content: All I wanted was a simple tablet the size of an I pad and that's what it is. Easy and fun to use, feels sturdy and not cheap (I think the kindle feels flimsy). The fact that you can't get as many apps with the Android/google system doesn't bother me. Large enough to browse the net on regular pages.

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: Rupinder Singh
Reviews.Content: Screen isn't the hardest but overall AMAZING TABLET FOR THE PRICE! I would recommend the more updated version, but this is very good too.

Reviews.Title: LePan  TC 970
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: having problems with turning tablet off. Attempted to contact customer service, from number listed on line,  no answer . Was on hold status for over 30 mins.  Also sent a e-mail to  customer service and received no amswer to email. very disappointed to tablet performance and customer service. would not recommend  anyone buy this item

Reviews.Title: non-existent post sale support-let the buyer beware
Reviews.Author: quesoburgesa "justin_down_under"
Reviews.Content: I purchased  tablet to do browsing and reading. As such, I can't comment on the performance of the tablet, except for to say that it seems to do everything I ask of it. However, in my opinion, post sale customer support is just as important as product quality, and lepan's support is non-existent. that's not an exaggeration- there simply IS NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT. I cracked my screen, and  contacted lepan via their website on two  occasions, inquiring about the cost of a screen replacement. It has been about a month since I first emailed them, and I have yet to receive a reply.bottom line? this tablet might be cheaper than many others, but apparently the lower price prevents lepan from hiring customer service staff. Either that, or Lepan's management just doesn't care about its existing customers, and wants to focus solely on new sales. I suggest you  buy a different  product.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: love
Reviews.Content: This product is terrible i havnt had it a month and it doesnt come  on ,Power button is broken and wont allow the system to cut on without resetting. now wont cut on at all. No damn warranty. Waste of my hard earn money......

Reviews.Title: Upset with LePan
Reviews.Author: Scott Wisotsky
Reviews.Content: Unfortunate event as I received a Lemon LePan ~ It worked for all of one day and then came to  screeching halt When calling LePan for help. HA!! May have well asked for Ice water you know where! I waited on the phone with a computer telling me I was the next caller in line, after being on line for what seemed like forever I looked down at my phone to see the timer and 2 HOURS! I hung up, called Amazon and asked for a refund, I am not dealing with a company that will not assist with customer service issues or with faulty equipment in a timely manner. Enough said. Was a waste of my time buying it. Amazon came through like always, had a shipping label and return RA# in my email before I finished the phone call and was willing to fully assist me with all issues. AWESOME JOB AMAZON!!! LePan should take some CSR skills from you!

Reviews.Title: Painful Experience
Reviews.Author: Sharhonda Boyd
Reviews.Content: I received the product within a reasonable time from seller PST (Poppy Seeds Toms) and was super excited when I received it. This was my 1st tablet. My 17yr old wanted one for Christmas and I thought, 'I am not getting her one without getting myself one'. Like others on here, I researched, read and decided on the one to get. She wanted a 7 inch ( so I purchased another brand for her AGPTek) but I thought I would try this one and see the difference in the 2 and I got me the LePan II.Out of the box, it was nice and it worked. I have 2 jobs and I like having my smartphone or laptop handy to work when necessary. The Lepan II did that... I was comfortable in my purchase. My daughter AGPTek came and it was ok but not as good as my LePan so I got her a Samsung (which is great by the way), bought anohter AGPTek and gave them to my sisters for Christmas.Everything was great until mine (the more expensive of them all) just stopped powering on. I was sick for a few days after Christmas and I just laid in the bed and used no type device to do anything. I didn't purchase a case for the tablet so I kept it in the plastic and in the box ( out of fear). I set up for about 1 week, no use at all. I am getting ready to return to work after the holidays and I wanted to begin checking emails and getting up to date... It would not power on. I thought ' it's dead, put it on the charger'. It sat on the charger for 5 hours, and it never came on. I read the suggestions from LePan on their website and other LePan forums and did all they suggested (hit reset, hit pwr for 30 sec,  reset + pwr, reset+ volume up, reset+ volume dwn, reset+ pwr and volume) nothing worked. I then saw someone that said they returned it to Amazon. So I contacted the seller (marketplace), who even gave me something to do (they said, that is the ICS for you), still nothing. I contacted LePan and I was on hold for over an hour, at work! I sent then an email, filled out the form..I contacted the seler again saying I want a refund.. they told me it was past their 14-15 day policy and that I needed to contact LePan. Well, that policy was not listed, they reference Amazon's policy so Amazon has put in a claim to get me refunded from the seller. The seller and I have gone back and forth as they do not believe that I am telling the truth (first they said, I was past the return point, then they said I probably broke it, then after they received they said it was heavily used and I switched the machine and sent them another one). So on top of this tablet not working, I am being called a crook by the seller.I am still waiting on that refund, but it hasn't been the 5 business days.Nonetheless, I wanted so bad to like this tablet. I loved the size and I love Androids but after less than 10 days of use, the power shouldn't be the issue. Furthermore, there shouldn't be this many people talking about this same issue. The thing just stopped coming on.I am an Amazon shopper. I don't like shopping and I hate large crowds, so sitting at my computer and shopping has been my thing. For the past 2 years, I have gone to the store at most 2 times during the Holidays. This experience, with the machine and especially with the seller had me in tears on Monday. I believe in shopping around and getting the best for the best price but my sanity was challenged with this purchase. It is already fearful purchasing online and especially electronic, but to feel hopeless like I have felt for the past 2 weeks with the seller and this machine will push me away. This is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: km
Reviews.Content: This Tablet was not what i expected it keeps freezing I cant watch videos and I plan to return both tablets I ordered

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: lOcO "lOcO"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for Christmas for my daughter. It worked great out of the box, and had no issues with connecting it to my home wireless network.After about 3 weeks, it decided to quit holding a charge. We tried resetting it numerous times, and leaving it on the charger overnight, still no good. I am returning it for a refund, and I hope that goes better than the expected life of this tablet did.With the other bad reviews I see posted here, my guess is the batteries they are installing in these units are not up to spec, and are therefore quitting prematurely. I cannot recommend this product, until the power issues with these units are resolved.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: anthjmon
Reviews.Content: It's fast and excellent when it works.... Every other time I touch the screen the stupid thing freezes!!i decided to return it because it just stopped turning on. le pan custermer support doesent answer at all. do not buy anything that says lepan on it!

Reviews.Title: Went through 4 of theses
Reviews.Author: SSCSJTCS
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that this tablet is still available for purchase. Overall the product is quite nice.  Good screen, case, etc. It has nice form and function.  However, we have gone through 4 of these in under a year.  We bought two in December, within 3 months, sent both back for broken power buttons.  Within another 6 months, we had a broken charger port (30pin).  This time we claimed the extended the warranty, that gave us a refund (bought Ipod to replace).  The 4th one finally suffered from another broken power button and it was claimed under the extended warranty as well.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase!
Reviews.Author: Anna Mundy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my husband so he could watch Netflix while he travels with his job.  I was very dissapointed to learn that this device does not ever allow updates, therefore, we were unable to use Netflix as well as other apps.  I advise anyone who is interested in this tablet to not waste their money as well as their time on purchasing this tablet.

Reviews.Title: doesnt work have to return it :(
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have to return it.  it only turns on for a few mins at a time. i could not even use it, it was a Christmas gift and has to be returned so that is a person without a gift and i feel bad about it too. the touch screen does not work most of the time and it freezes up and will not even turn on after that for hours.  I am disappointed.  I will never buy a LePan again.  :(

Reviews.Title: No support
Reviews.Author: Charles Bull
Reviews.Content: The LePan is very difficult to work with, and you can get zero support from the support line , they promise responses but they never come. I have tried E-Mail and telephone,multiple times, with no usable results. If what you want to do is not Google oriented then it is next to impossible to do. The web searches are not complete and it is difficullt to download a book except thru Amazon. The users manual is next to useless.

Reviews.Title: Very Disapointed
Reviews.Author: Oscar O Jimenez
Reviews.Content: I am very disapointed in this product. I read many reviews from previous buyers before deciding to buy.  The Le Pan tablet was very slow, which I would have suffered knowing what I paid for it.  However, I had to reset it three times within an hour just to get it to work. Thirdly, everytime I went to rotate the tablet the screen would glitch up and not work right. Spend a little extra and get something better.

Reviews.Title: don't buy!
Reviews.Author: getzbird101
Reviews.Content: we got our first or le pan ll in May . it worked less than a month . It just stopped charging then wouldn't turn on. FINALLY got got ahold of the company after getting the run around for several months . This was in October! The sent us a replacement the week before Christmas and now on New Years day it stopped charging again and again won't turn on. What a joke! sending it back and demanding my money back!

Reviews.Title: not happy with tablet
Reviews.Author: Teresa Gunn
Reviews.Content: I was told this was a realy reliable table and you can do lots with it.. But tha tablet freezes ALOT.. I would not recommend this tablet for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: I don't get it..
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just my le pan that sucks. I'm not technically savvy so I won't give you a complete run down on the pros & cons. What I will do is list my problems with this tablet that I recieved for a birthday/Christmas gift last year (2011). I researched a lot of tablets before choosing this one. I don't  have cable access so I wanted something I could watch TV on but no such luck, the tablet will start the program & then either freeze or shutdown OR the program won't recognize the android programming (Hulu for example). It does the same thing with youtube & other video formats. Also, even with added memory (sd card) I've still run out of space with my music & pictures and the videos...forget about it, it will shut off while you think you're still recording & you won't  know until you're  finished because the camera is front facing. I don't know if there is an upgrade but if so I'm in dire need of one...very disatisfied.

Reviews.Title: JUNK!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Big Daddy
Reviews.Content: JUNK! First tablet lasted about two months then went dead.  Contacted LePan, went through an exhaustive process to return it.  They claimed the first one was defective and sent me a new one.  That one did not work at all.  Now they will not return my emails. DO NOT BUY! Would not give it any stars! Total piece of JUNK!

Reviews.Title: Could be better..
Reviews.Author: Niladri Chatterjee "NILADRI CHATTERJEE"
Reviews.Content: I am using this LePan 970 Tablet for last two months. I have summarized my experience:-Pros:1. Very Affordable compared to I Pad, Samsung (really good quality but price $600+ !).2. Lot cheaper than Nook or Kindle (they are even smaller screen size, with higher price).3. Excellent design. Good engineering quality in the Tablet Model itself.4. Very thin and light. Nice finish.5. Compared to other Tablet (All "Class C" Tablets), will give you a competitive quality, with reasonable price. (Unlike I Pad / Samsung, Share Price minded price tag !)6. You can add up to 32 GM Micro SD Card (I did too).Cons:1. Possessor is extreme slow, although it says 1 Ghz.2. Memory is only 256 MB (less than 10 years old Computer). You need I MB atleast.3. Internet access is slow, even if your are have 40 MBPS connection.4. You can watch Netflix, without any problem. CNN, YouTube streamline video works with slow connectivity.5. The Tablet freezes many times, only option, having a Paper Clip, handy to pock on the back side "reset" opening.6.  "Le Pan Customer Service" is horrible..! Only option to contact, by e-mail, which they with hardly reply back. At least I don't see any of my issue answered.My suggestion, you may first try Le Pan 970 II, at $250. It ought to be better than Le Pan 970..  If that does not work for you, call Amazon Customer Service that tell them you want you buy a "Samsung". Amazon will replace.Hope this helps !

Reviews.Title: There is a defect Beware!!!
Reviews.Author: JCurlowicz
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks of use the POWER BUTTON, which is the most important button, does not work! Now I'm having to go through the manufacturer to get it fixed because I bought it a month ahead of time for my sons bday. They seem to know about the button defect yet there is NO RECALL! So beware of purchasing this product!!!!

Reviews.Title: Piece of Garbage
Reviews.Author: Mary Miller Petteys
Reviews.Content: Delayed sensitivity. Turned on inconsistently. Now, will not turn on at all. Fritzed out very first day. Has a mind of its own. Runs Netflix poorly. Now, I am returning it, and getting no where with customer service. Gah!

Reviews.Title: Only took 3 days for it to prove itself a piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Bri
Reviews.Content: I received my Le Pan on Saturday and Today (Monday) I've already sent in for a replacement. I figure I'll give it one more chance before I exchange it for a different product. It is constantly freezing up, I've had to hit the pinhole sized restart button at least 20 times and done 3 factory resets. Now suddenly the top part of the screen has started flickering and if I let the screen turn off it won't turn back on. Also it took about 4 hours for it to fully charge from empty and only about 2 hours of use to run it back down. I'm really hoping my replacement will be a little less disappointing, otherwise I'll be returning it for something that actually functions.

Reviews.Title: returning this one
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this tablet, I really did.  It's the fourth tablet (and third Android) I've purchased, but after having become accustomed to the Le Pan II and Android 4.0, this is absolutely painful to use.  It's GREAT for the price, you can still check email, surf the web (slowly), view Netflix with lockups, and read the comparatively terrible experience on the Amazon Kindle app.  Android 4.0 is a much more seamless experience in a lot of little ways.  The build quality is great, and it gets the job done.  I just can't _ever_ see preferring this over even the Netbook sitting about the house.  Do yourself a favor, and spring for the Le Pan II which is an amazing and wonderful tablet, or if funds are an issue, spend a little more and get a Nexus 7.  I suppose it's quite functional as a cheap tablet for the kids as well, and about the best you can expect for $130.

Reviews.Title: frozen
Reviews.Author: regina
Reviews.Content: THe price of this tablet was great..but,  cant help but think that i should have spent the extra money for a better one....there is only a foward facing camera..so i cant take this to family events and take pictures because i wouldnt be able to see what im taking pictures of because the camera is on the front of the tablet..and if i did..its i hope i got the pic situation..The tablet freezes up to the point you cant use it until the battery is dead...so last night it froze with a fully charged battery ..I couldnt use it until this afternoon because it was froze all night...you cant download certain games because he touch screen is not compatible...I wouldnt recommend this to a person who loves using it all the time.

Reviews.Title: I had initially rated awesome but now..
Reviews.Author: Sheryl L. Ford "Sheryl Ford"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the version of android loaded on the tablet will not allow  netflix or youtube.  Those are huge problems.  There is no netflix at all now ever and after the update, the youtube thats on the tablet is useless 90% of the time.  Too bad because the tablet initially had so much potetial.  I DID love this tablet enough to get another...but now netflix does not and will not be supporting froyo 2.2.  Oh how I loved being able to watch movies/TV where ever and when ever.  I think for netflix to stop their service "suddely"..literally in the middle of a movie is very sad.  Now I have two tablets with NO netflix.  Le pan refuses to update the security certificates and netflix can not or will not help customers work around this issue.Below was my origanal reveiw.  I bought first tablet just a couple of months ago here on amazon for 128.00.  I went to get another and the price had increased 50.00.  Would not have gotten the second if I had know about the  netflix/youtube issues.Has a nice display....thats about it.

Reviews.Title: I bought 4 of these tablets for my kids
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Parker
Reviews.Content: look and feel great but I have sent three of the units back and one back twice.  There is a problem with the on/off button that after use makes it impossible to turn the unit off and turning it on by using the reset button.  Customer service through the website has been fairly responsive but I can not recommend or would I buy another LePan product.

Reviews.Title: Stop debating and just buy it!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Thomas "ebtswtmommy"
Reviews.Content: I took months to decide which tablet to buy.  I was buying two of them for my kids as Christmas presents back in December of 2011.  I came across the LePan and decided to give it a shot after purchasing about 3 different cheaper Android Tablets.  I had a hell of a time trying to get apps to run on the cheaper tablets and finally bit the bullet and got the LePans.  We love them.  It was a fantastic decision.  My kids use them basically to play Angry birds and my oldest is always reading and listening to music on them.  We did not try to Skype or stream videos or anything, so I cannot really comment on those capabilities.  My oldest also uses it to go online at home to do her HW.  The kids take them in the car with them all the time so it has really cut down on the back seat bickering!  YEAH!!!  In the house, 2400 SQFT two levels, we've never had a problem connecting to our WiFi network.  They've also worked perfectly well in hotels.  I've never tried them anywhere else.  BTW, I knew we would not be buying Ipads due to the cost, so my criteria was something that could play games, let them do their HW in the kitchen, let them read and listening to music was very important.  They've delivered on all accounts.  I was not too concerned with being able to upgrade them.  I figured for the price, it was exactly what we needed.  HTH!!

Reviews.Title: Great Touchpad
Reviews.Author: kish
Reviews.Content: After doing A LOT of research, I found the Lepan Touchpad 970. Not only is this product cost efficient, it is capable of doing all the basic stuff that I need. If you are looking for something basic and under $300 (including shipping), then this is the right product. You may want to buy a screen protector and case (both are recommended under the "review" section. Although, I am very happy with this purchase; I have a few "cons" listed below.ConsThis product does not come with a manual but it is easy to use.The power button is very small (not a big deal)Hard to find accessories in a store for Lepan productsA little heavy.Overall, this is a great product.I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Loved the device, hated the instability!
Reviews.Author: Kayla in Lake Charles
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy, user friendly tablet... there are many Android Apps available within the Google Playstore and all integrate well with this device.  I enjoyed it for the first week or so... however my first red flag occurred within the first 48 hours of use.  It froze up to the point that a 'hard restart' had to be performed by utilizing the 'reset' button on the back of the tablet.  Initially I thought that this was just happenstance and hoped that it wouldn't happen again.  I had the device a total of three weeks and it would freez up to the point that I would have to use the reset button about every third use.  To keep something that demonstrated this level of instability within the first 30 days made me extremely uneasy... so unfortunately I sent it back.  I was disappointed because the functionality of the device was awesome.  I ended up purchasing a Kindle Fire, and like it okay, but really prefer the size of the LePan for visability.

Reviews.Title: Freezes
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: My unit, bought in Nov 2011, freezes several times daily. Aside from  that the tablet is good. The customer service is non-existent... can't get a hold of anyone. No phone or email answers to questions. Poor. Beware.

Reviews.Title: Would never spend money on an IPAD.
Reviews.Author: L&NsMommy89
Reviews.Content: The first one I recieved was pretty slow. But I tried again and I use my "Le Pan Tablet PC" every single day. Facebbok, checkig email, and little games here and there. As long as you take care of this and keep it cleaned up and not too many programs running this is AWESOME. Way cheaper than what you will pay for an IPAD. All my friends and family that see it and play with it leave saying they wish they had one and would've done the research like I did to find this awesome deal! This comes with a one page insctructions, VERY simple to use. I would highly recommened to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Not GOod For Me!
Reviews.Author: Jonnham
Reviews.Content: Ive had the Le Pan for about 4 months, and Im sorry to say I wish I bought something else. THe software is scatchy and outdated and non upgradable. WHat I hate the most is the lack of video viewing formates.. I do volunteer work with the deaf and I need to put lots of video on a portable station. But this stupid thing wont play must formatss and I can't spend all my time converting all the publications into something compatable. Very disapointed. But I should have thought of this, but I did not. So Im letting yall Know... Very few video formats! But it might be good enoughh for you. BUt Im getting rid of this thing

Reviews.Title: Amazon happy customer
Reviews.Author: chloegm
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband. I am so happy with it .He hardly puts it down. You name it does it.I would recommend it to anyone .It's a great tablet.The Le PAN 970

Reviews.Title: The item get spoilt fast.
Reviews.Author: Daryl Thong
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time but first thing to go was the on/off switch just after a month of receiving it. Now it totally does not come on and died on me. Totally frustrating. I wish i could return it. For the price i though it was nice the first time we received it but only after 4 months, well...i am very dissapointed. Did not please me at all.Maybe i was one of the unlucky ones to have received a faulty product.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTED TABLET
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS LE PAN TABLET, USE IT FOR 30 DAYSTHE POWER BUTTON GOT PROBLEM, I CAN'T TURN IT ONAFTER 30 DAYS AMAZON RETURN POLICY HAD EXPIRED ...I CONTACT THE LE PAN MANUFACTURER, THEY ASK TO RETURN FOR SERVICE.WHICH I DID, AFTER 30 DAYS NOW... I AM STILL WAITING TO GET MY TABLET BACKTHIS IS THE RESPONSE I RECEIVED FROM THE LE PAN"Unfortunately at this time we do not have a tentative date to ship your tablet out. Due to a high volume of RMAs we will be shipping them out based on those we have had the longest. We apologize for the delay."I JUST HAVE TO WAIT TO SEE THE CONCLUSION....BY THE WAY JUST BOUGHT THE NEW IPAD, ITS A GREAT POWERFUL TOOL

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for over six months after returning several others to the store.  It is a great value for the price- runs most apps, surfing the web is a breeze, and I love the kindle app.  I download content from the library no problem, and I've used it to record audio/video with little struggle.  This tablet has been dropped on the pavement, thrown across the room by my two year old, and used frequently by my five-year old.  It remains intact and works like a charm.  It has been intuitive since the beginning- very easy to use.  It didn't really come with a user manual (there's a pdf on the device) but I never needed it anyway.As others have said, fingerprints are an issue, but the sturdiness is worth the extra effort.  Beware, however, that the latest android version is ice cream sandwich, and to my knowledge there isn't an upgrade for this device, so some of the newest apps may not work.  Also, I had  some trouble getting the FirstIssue magazine app to download.This tablet will do the majority of tasks the average person wants- internet, ereader, apps, games, video/youtube, pictures- most of my friends think I forked out the money for ipad, but I really spent less than $200!  I've been extremely pleased.  I would definitely purchase another device from this maker.  Check out the youtube reviews- they are great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: k "smath62"
Reviews.Content: After reading all the favorable reviews, I purchased a Le Pan 2 for each member of our family of four.  We got them this week and we are very happy with them.  They are very user friendly, nice clear screen, Netflix up and running for all of us immediately(I mention this because some users mentioned having difficulty with their Netflix access) A very good value and so far we are super pleased with them.  We also purchased the Targus case/stand and it is a great and sturdy case.  Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING FOR THE PRICE!!!
Reviews.Author: luv2shop4mybabies
Reviews.Content: This an amazing tablet big screen, great internet browsing, full Android Market, also rooting is availible to unlock its full potential. The carmera isn't the best, but it's a camera. Also has very long battery life, which I am surprised at. I bought this for my 14 year old son and he loves it!

Reviews.Title: Would buy another one
Reviews.Author: Tumirrow L. Jones
Reviews.Content: I decided that I was going to buy a tablet. I had bought a tablet in the past and was not too happy with the price and the lack of functionality. I researched and went through the reviews for the Le pan and was excited about this product. Once it came into the mail, I never looked back. I enjoyed the screen size, its durability, and the apps. I liked it so much that even my professor bought one. Im thinking about upgrading to the Le Pan II and giving this one to my mother. The thing that I enjoy the most is that easy access and the PRICE! How can you beat that. A must have.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan TC 970 - Great Cheap Tablet
Reviews.Author: kkamalx
Reviews.Content: I received my TC 970 tablet about a week ago, very quick shipping, got it in 2 days. I have been playing with it for few days now and I have to say, for a price tag of $199, its an amazing tablet. Yes it only comes with Android 2.2 (Froyo), and they don't have any update available for Gingerbread, Honeycomb or ICS 4.0. But for just browsing, watching videos, playing games and using apps like Skype, Facebook and others, its a great tablet. Yes there are few games that cant be installed, because of the high requirements of the game, but I don't care, but if you do care then spend $80 more and get Le Pan II for $279. It has the QUALCOMM 1.2GHz Dual-core Snapdragon processor and more memory. But I have to say my expectation with TC 970 was very low until I got it, I was just amazed at the quality and performance of this tablet. With 1GHz single-core TI Arm Cortex 8 and 512MB memory it performs well. With that said don't try to compare this with iPad2, but it does 75% of what iPad2 can do, and for only $199 compared to $500 its an amazing deal. I do own an iPad2 also. Few small things, the internal built-in flash NAND storage is only 2GB, so buy a $20 32GB micro-sd card and stick it in. It comes with 2GB SD card already, but I think that's small if you want to store pics and movies on it. Yes the tablet does some time gets slow after you have too many applications running, so either kill the task in task manager or reboot. I have only had to do it once since I got it. The big plus this tablet has over other cheap ones is the Google Market app (now Google Play) which is already configured and this tablet is certified for it.
