You don't have to first root the device and install it like other cheap ones. But I still recommend rooting the device, opens up the tablet for a lot more stuff then whats on GooglePlay (not that its any less stuff there). So if you want a budget tablet that works great, this is a good candidate. I am still playing with the tablet, if I find anything else I will update.

Reviews.Title: Le pan
Reviews.Author: Bman
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my 8 year old daughter. So far so good. Nice quality for the price. Better than I expected. Just not as responsive and smooth as the IPad but for the price can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Almost gave up on it
Reviews.Author: Neo2000x "Neo2000x"
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of others who own the Le Pan II, I was experiencing continuous Wifi issues.  I had problems connecting to the internet even though I had a full strength connection to my router.  My Le Pan was the only device in the household that had these problems.  I even returned my first Le Pan II as I thought it might be a lemon but my 2nd Le Pan II had the same issue.  The only work around to getting the Wifi working was resetting the router each time I connected which became very cumbersome.I was just about to give up and return my Le Pan II again until I decided to try an older router.  Since other reviewers had no Wifi issues I suspected that the problem could be router related.  After switching from a Motorola SBG900 Wireless Surfboard Gateway (the one Comcast gives) to a Trendnet TEW-432BRP, all my issues went away.  My Le Pan II now works great and I will be keeping it.  I'm not sure why the Le Pan II works well with some routers and not others, but maybe someone can look into it.It's a nice tablet however Le Pan really needs to provide more software support.  The Bluetooth needs an update and the software currently does not support the HDMI output.  Despite these issues it's a great tablet at a great price.  I could go on about all the things that the tablet does do right however all the other reviewers have already done that well.

Reviews.Title: Owned for 1 month: love it
Reviews.Author: J. Schaa "Destructo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this table for work. I just received the logitech bluetooth keyboard for my birthday and am using that to write this review on the le pan ii. The tablet is flat out awesome.It runs so smooth, it is easy to use and it is also very easy to bluetooth tether to my phone. All you have to do is turn on the bluetooth on your phone and the tablet, turn off the wifi on the tablet. Search bluetooth devices and connect to the phone. Then click the wrench next to the phone connection on the tablet, click use this for your internet connection. And there you go, I was streaming netflix on 3g in a parking lot the other day.Anyway the tablet is so smooth, I have used a lot of tablets from friends and in the store. Including spending significant time on a kindle fire. We were thinking about getting a kindle fire but then I realized for 80 more dollars you get, bluetooth, gps, larger screen, google play, and hopefully in the near future ice cream sandwich. you can buy 2 of these for the price of an ipad. Totally worth it and smokes the competition from what I can tell.

Reviews.Title: Great product, cheap power button
Reviews.Author: CCAT Racing
Reviews.Content: Worked great, rooted easy, plays videos, netflix, android market. Was very happy the 2 weeks owning it! Battery life was VERY poor, but I bought a customer returned unit so it could have been defective. I used it in my car plugged in so it did not matter to me. But then, it slid off a couple books and barely tapped the corner where the power button is on the table. I thought nothing of it until later when I tried to shut it down. The power button broke and stayed depressed, and could not turn it off or on. I erased all my info, reset back to factory mode and returned it. I paid twice as much for a Galaxy Tab 10.1, but the Le Pan actually played games better! Others have reported a faulty power button as well. I suppose that is why they went to Le Pan II.  Sorry, as good as it worked, I give it a 2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Love My Le Pan II
Reviews.Author: Charles H. High II "chighii"
Reviews.Content: I have had it now for 2 months,waited 3 weeks for it.I gotta tell you I'm more than impressed and very addicted to it.I don't really understand the front firing camera only but I don't really use that anyway.The unit itself works very well,never having owned an android before,the apps are very easy to download and use.I really can't see any down side to this tablet.For under 200.00 it cannot be beat!New iPads are out,no thank you I will take my Le Pan anytime and save alot of money.The battery last a very long time,the picture is bright and clear,very sharp and I can watch movies on it .I would give it 5 stars no problem.If your looking for a very good tablet and do not want to spend a fortune this is it.C.High.Lake Mary,FL.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: DeShawn McWhorter
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my Mom's Birthday and now I want my own.  It is fantastic!!! She absolutely LOVES IT!!! I bought a cheap Belkin wireless router so the tablet is really fast.  The screen graphic is beautiful and of course what I love the most is that it's an android tablet.  And this thing only cost $200.00 bucks.  Don't spend 500.00 on an ipad when you can have this Gem.  It also has good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Froze three times today
Reviews.Author: Oleg Mikheev
Reviews.Content: ANOTHER EDIT (10 days):Just when I was about to think that freezes went away it froze again. So:1. It's not possible to use this tablet without carrying a paper clip along2. Taking into account that this product is on the market for at least one year and this freezing issue is well known to distributors and the manufacturer and a number of fix attempts via firmware updates were released the only conclusion is that this is a hardware problem. Which means that they continue to knowingly sell a product that is defective in essence.Some reviewers are saying that it is Android or tablets' nature to hang. I own a number of Android devices including G1 (the first Android ever) and none of them ever needed a reset. They don't even have a reset button!EDIT (1 week):After some experiments I managed to make this thing work. Or am I just lucky and some wire got crossed inside after a couple of bangs?...With a combination of the free MX Player (from Market, now renamed to Play Store) and the latest 'leaked' firmware [...] this tablet became more or less stable, it didn't freeze for three days now. But still I refuse to understand how come they are selling a device that's guaranteed to freeze very often without applying some hack like efforts. So no more than 2 stars, sorry.ORIGINAL (a couple of days of usage):My aim was to get a tablet for my toddler to watch kids cartoons and play some simple games. My kid (1.7 y.o) tends to throw stuff on the floor when he gets too irritated, alas the price of the purchase had to be minimized. Le Pan was the cheapest one with a full 10 inch screen, so I thought it would be good enough for the purpose.I can say that the screen is really good. View angle is excellent, the screen is very bright.But unfortunately the device is not very usable as it freezes very often for no reason at all. I've connected it to my laptop via USB, uploaded a couple of cartoons. It refused to play most of them, just played the MP4 one.I've installed BS player and it played FLV ones in software mode which sucked - the cartoon video was kind of slow which caused out of sync with audio.When I tried to play toons it would sometime freeze in the middle of it, or refused to play it from the start displaying an alert window on top of a garbage video background which could only be removed by restarting the device with Reset button.And right now it just froze for just no reason.So, anyway, I think that I will be able to convert all of my kids cartoons to some format that this device could tolerate, and will hope that my kid hits it really hard against the wall in the next couple of months which would justify a purchase of a better one.PS: I've tried all of their updated firmwares, both official and 'leaked'. No difference.

Reviews.Title: Looks sharp and does everything I expected!
Reviews.Author: Danimal
Reviews.Content: I did some research before I actually took the plunge and bought the Le Pan.  First I was looking at the Kindle Fire and the HP Touchpad, but this tablet snuck in there and after reading many positive reviews I decided it had everything I was wanting and at a great price none the less!  I would definitely recommend this to anyone who does not feel like dropping some serious cash on an ipad.  The Tablet itself feels well built and had a real cool look and finish to it as well!

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for the given price.
Reviews.Author: avravi
Reviews.Content: I waited two months before writing a review so that I might come across any defects in this tablet, if there were any.... and I couldn't find any so far. Sure this tablet does not have 3G and back camera, but it does what it says it will and that is enough for most of us. Everything works smooth including the touch screen and I really could not find any flaws in it.The only con I can tell is the placing of the microSD drive. It is placed in such a position, which makes it difficult to remove and replace the card. Since we are not going to change the card so often, it is not such a big issue, but even then I thought it worth mentioning.I am using a 16GB microSD and did not find any slowing down of the tablet and I am going to try a 32GB card soon.Overall, my experience with this tablet is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price!
Reviews.Author: Mark K.
Reviews.Content: I just got my tablet late last week and I absolutely love it!  I have an Android phone, so using the tablet is second nature for me.  I really like the large 9.7" screen size.  It gives Apple a run for their money as it's just a big as an iPad, yet less than HALF the cost of one.  The speed could be a little better, but I suppose that's what the Le Pan II is for.  lol.  Something else I was very impressed with is the battery life.  If I used my Android smartphone for as long as I do my tablet, I would maybe get an hour tops out of it.  But this tablet goes for at least 3 hours before it starts to run low.  Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase and want everyone in the market for one to consider this one and not just default to buying an iPad and eventually waste money on something that does most of what this awesome table can do.  Happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Real Deal
Reviews.Author: gIZ
Reviews.Content: My son purchased the Le Pan I originally and has had great success with it. So when time came for me to move into this new technology the Le Pan II became available. For the price you can't go wrong. Lighweight, big screen, and easy to get around. Haven't had any issues but I only have had it a few weeks, however, would like to see the on/off button off the edge a little as the case holder corner is to close for my big fingers. No sure if the tablet or the Targus case is the issue. For me? The price was the real deal compared to the cost of other tablets.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet and great price
Reviews.Author: Ehroof
Reviews.Content: Does much better than anything close in this price range, i am very happy with it, does everything you want and more, web, email, video, netflix, etc.... what else is there?

Reviews.Title: A great tablet.
Reviews.Author: playerj40
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet yesterday and i love it! It is my first android device but i have had three IOS devices.The good:This tablet exceeded my expectations when it comes to speed. Every app i have tried runs smoothly and the response time is spot on. The graphics are great and the sound quality is adequate. However the sound is not something you would want to listen to music or watch movies with so expect to need headphones for such things. That being said the sound quality is great for YouTube and app sound effects it is loud enough for me not to have to turn it all the way up. I have run into a few apps that don't work with this tablet but, i believe it has to do with android and not the tablet itself. For those people who may be interested Netflix works great and plays in HD. Overall this is a great tablet and worth every penny.The not so good:The only complaints i have are the wifi and fingerprints. When i first connected to the wifi i was only pulling half of what i should have been getting but, i applied the fix that an earlier reviewer posted and it works fine now but it was a little troublesome to begin with. And of course this tablet is covered with finget prints but when the screen is on they are unnoticeable so its no big deal.So if your thinking of buying this but, are unsure of the performance i say go for it you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: TC970 Beyond Expectations
Reviews.Author: Loretta Simmons
Reviews.Content: I purchased TC970 after pouring over all of the reviews for inexpensive tablets and decided that the Le Pan was the best choice. I was not disappointed, actually it is 100 times better that I imagined. I have used other people's Ipad's and a buddy's Samsung Galaxy 10.1 and I don't think the difference in the price of both of those is worth it. I have had the TC970 for about a week and a half and it has performed beyond my expectations. I have updated the firmware and installed many apps and I only had to reset the tablet once when I used it and the battery was needing a recharge and locked up.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan Tablet Review
Reviews.Author: Le Pan Tablet
Reviews.Content: I bought the tablet online for my daughter.It's like a cross between a laptop and larger ipod.She enjoys using it. It has all the featuresand it was reasonably priced.  I am happy with it.We compared prices at Walmart, Best Buy, Radio Shackand found it on Amazon.com for less.Julie P,Hartford, CTLe Pan TC 970 9.7-Inch Multi-Touch LCD Google Android Tablet PC

Reviews.Title: Why I chose this tablet....
Reviews.Author: -Mimi-
Reviews.Content: I have been looking at tablets for MONTHS!  I have been to every store in town that has tablets trying various brands while comparing specs.  I finally had to stop myself ans ask what AM I looking for in a tablet?  What will I truly use it for?  When I realized what my uses were, I thought WHY spend a ton of money.  I want a big enough screen to be able to surf the net, get apps from android, read on a bigger screen, watch a movie on a road trip and play games without waiting 5 minutes per screen load.  As you can see, nothing too fancy, just every day normal usage.  This price was perfect.  This tablet has all I want and then some for under $300!!!  I hope Amazon doesn't mind that I got tired of waiting for them to stock these so I ordered mine from Best Buy tonight.  I did have to pay more because of shipping and tax but patience isn't one of my better virtues!  It will be here in 2/7 or 2/8!!The biggest thing that stands out to me as a concern is the 30 pin connector vs. other tablets.  The main reason I didn't go with the Ipad months ago was the lack of an sd card for extra storage.  Yes it has cloud storage BUT that doesn't help if I don't have wifi access.  With an sd card, I always have my files available.I will update when I get my tablet but I am VERY excited about my purchase!!  Now to decide on a case for it......UPDATE (2/7/12):  I have received my tablet.  Let it charge and proceeded to check it out.  I absolutely love this tablet!  I have had no problems with wifi connections, downloads/installs from the market were very quick and seamless, games are flawless, no lag so far etc.  The clarity is amazing.  The only problem I have encountered is that my husband was watching while I was playing with it and now he wants one TOO! lol  I highly recommend this tablet.  You can NOT go wrong for the money!

Reviews.Title: Best In Class
Reviews.Author: hangdogdaddy
Reviews.Content: As I set here watching the state of the union address on my Le Pan TC-970 I continue to be truly impressed with it's performance and value. Fit and finish are the same as you would find on tablets such as HP's Touch smart. It has an LG display that is beautiful. There is glare from the gloss surface but a mat screen protector will take care of any glare. Sound is loud and surprisingly clear. This tablet includes Android's full market. Very few if any give you the full market at this price point. The company also seems to be committed  to  support as new firmwares have been issued recently. There is also a growing amount of support over at xdadevelopers.com Root is available now. Team this tablet up with the Targus Truss case for the HP Touchpad and a 16gb micro sd card and you'll have a very capable tablet.

Reviews.Title: Can't be beat for the price
Reviews.Author: FG
Reviews.Content: This tablet is fantastic, there is no doubt about it.  I have used it daily for a month now.  I absolutely love it.  Set-up was a breeze, connected to my home wi-fi, synced my mail and calendar, started downloading my favorite apps from the market in minutes.  The response is faster than my laptop and blows away my previous Sylvania Tablet.  The quality of build on this matches the iPad for a fraction of the price and the screen is just as vibrant.  This tablet has exceeded my expectations by a mile.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet - Problem with connectivity
Reviews.Author: SML1950 "Mikie1950"
Reviews.Content: I really liked everything about this tablet out of the box. It was ready to go and easy to operate. This was my first tablet. I have a moderate knowledge base regarding computers as I was a technology coordinator for a small educational cooperative for several years.I went into the settings, found my router and connected.  The tablet indicated that I was connected.  I went to Google and it loaded.  I typed in "horse" and got a search page for horses. The connection was dropped. I could not search for another term nor could I access msn or yahoo.  It continued to indicate that I was connected to my router.I tried changing configurations on my router to no avail.  The tablet could find my router, would indicate that I was connected, but would not access the internet. During this mess, I went to tablet forums and found out that this was a problem with a few of the Le Pan TC970s. It is not a common occurance or there would be lower ratings. The problem has to do with tablet compatibility with the routers. With no small amound of sadness I requested an RMA, sent it back and ordered an Amazon Fire.

Reviews.Title: For Casual Users only
Reviews.Author: JustTheFacts
Reviews.Content: - This is a great tablet for 1/3 price of an IPAD2.- Use IPAD2 covers & case($7). They fit almost perfect except the navigation buttons and camera. I cut those out to tailor fit.- SD micro card upgraded to 32mb ($29).- Movies (flv,mp4) are easily recognized on the SD card by navigating to the folder you place it in.- I own an IPOD Touch, but getting use to the Android system is easy & intuitive. More flexible than iTunes. Keeps the tablet independent of the PC, with connections to PC if needed (MicroSD, USB, BlueTooth).- Speakers are very good------------------------------------ Standby & Freezing----------------------------------The StandBy mode does not work. If I allow the unit to go into Standby, I will need to press the reset button to restart it. I always turn the unit OFF when I'm done. It takes 20 seconds to turn ON, and another 20 seconds to grab onto WIFI. As a casual user, I don't mind waiting 1 minute for the unit to come up and ready. For business users, this is no good.The unit also freezes sometimes. A few times in the middle of a Appl download. I reset to restart and it continued & finish download. A few times in the middle of just using it. Again, for casual use, no problem. I'm not sure if this is inherently an Android 2.2 issue, or a LePan hardware issue.They should have just made a button for the RESET switch vs the indented style that requires a sharp object to press. I keep a paperclip with my case to reset the unit.-------------------------- Summary------------------------For Casual users it is an excellent mix of functionality, speed & value.Not for business or heavy users due to Standby & Freezing issues.####### UPDATE #######################################################After returning my unit for a replacement, all the issues above have been resolved. No more freezing, and the standby works wonderfully. Obviously, the last unit was malfunctioning and thanks to other Amazon reviewers that replied back with their experience, it convinced me to return and hope for a better unit.  Raising my review from 4 stars to 5 stars now. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Little Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had my Le Pan tablet for several weeks.  Out of the box I encountered a few problems.  I had a "blue screen of death" 3-4 times in a row, which forced me to re-boot the machine with a clean install.  However, this problem resolved on the first day and has not resurfaced.  I put in a 32gb SD card to replace the standard 2gb card that came with the Le Pan.Overall the functionality is fine.  Although this is my first tablet, I've played with a number of other models (iPad, Xoom, etc.), and Le Pan seems to hold up.  The screen is quite responsive.  The apps all work well.

Reviews.Title: Great at first, but....
Reviews.Author: StoryGirl2C "Suz"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: 1/12/12:All that glitters ain't gold!At first glance, this is a neat little tablet.  However, I had major issues with it dropping the wi-fi signal in my relatively small house after a few lengthy web browsing sessions.  This became a quite a nuisance.We attempted connecting the tablet to a portable hot-spot via Bluetooth.  Well, the tablet could/would not connect via Bluetooth (though it has Bluetooth capability.) Also, because it has ONLY A PROPRIETARY USB PORT (not standard), we couldn't link the two manually.The tablet doesn't come with any kind of manual that could've possibly explained or helped to resolve some of the issues we were having. As I was looking for a simple tablet that Mom would be able to basically turn on and roll with, calls to to tech support, or endless tinkering/tweaking are NOT desired...so this puppy had to be returned.*************************************************************************************************I purchased this tablet for my mother for Christmas. She's technologically challenged, so I'm setting up everything before it goes under the tree. She'll be able to get started using it the moment the wrapping paper comes off.I must say, that like most other reviewers, I'm impressed with the quality feel and design of this tablet.  My order arrived promptly and the tablet was already charged enough for me to get to work setting it up and downloading apps immediately!  The display is excellent and it's perfect for mom to see it with or without her reading glasses.My only complaint is that the keyboard case that's depicted with this tablet...does not fit and as the tablet has only a proprietary usb accessory port, the keyboard cannot be connected to it anyhow.  I'm not sure how I missed that little kernel of info during my research.Luckily, I plan to purchase a different kind of tablet for myself, so I'll keep this keyboard/case for that one.All in all, this is a terrific tablet for the price.  I'll update this review once mom's had a chance to weigh in with her "novice's" viewpoint.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: THolland
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Lepan last week as a present for my kids and i received it within the time i was told it would be delivered. Very impressive out of the box! It has a nice weight to it and seems to be made very well. I have been playing with it for a few days and this tablet is more than capable of handling the things my kids (and i) will use it for (games, YouTube & Internet). I used on my personal wi-fi and at work and was able to access the internet without any problems and the speed was good. I have downloaed several apps from the Market and they have worked great. I put the live aquarium as the wallpaper and the colors are great!!! The The battery does seem to have good life (about 2-3 hours continuos use) which is better than my Dell laptop and the only reason i did not rate five stars is because the battery does take a long time to recharge. I highly recommend this as a gift for kids and adults, especially at the price. I have a friend who paid $350 for a similar tablet and this one does everything hers does. GREAT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice Android tablet but be aware of some glitches.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tech"
Reviews.Content: This WAS an incredible device. Great price and speed. Gorgeous screen.Excellent build quality ( while it lasted) Battery life looked promising.Unfortunately the device is now dead after only 2 days of use!? And I had JUST finished updating and data transfer.I was going to enjoy a thorough test of the unit... Grrrr. Power and reset buttons unresponsive. We'll get to see how their tech support works I guess.Be aware it won't go past Android 2.2.The glass is super fingerprint magnet but no big deal.4:3 ratio screen was way better than my former 16:9 device.Flimsy power/usb 30 pin connector will need some special care.Budget for an 8-32 gig SD card to have some room for movies/music.Super fast response from LePan and Amazon regarding dead unit.Returned defective unit and awaiting replacement.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: gthax
Reviews.Content: Best tablet at this price, very fast, great screen, fast web browser, lots of apps, great build quality, very responsive touch screen. The best and fastest browser available is the Opera mobile browser, download in the android app store, it's free and fast. The best case I have found that it fits perfect is the Targus Truss case made for the Ipad 1 and 2, its a case and stand in one. If you have been on the fence about getting a tablet but could'nt pull the trigger, for around 200.00, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: I was bummed when I missed out on the closeouts of the HP Touchpad. I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a tablet when I have 2 small children. So, I'd been looking for some time for a tablet that was reasonably priced & got good reviews. I am so happy to have found LePan. I have an Android phone, so for me, it was simple to use. It's not perfect & I'm sure if you're really techy or want all the bells & whistles & latest OS, etc, this isn't for you. But, if you're looking for a good quality tablet that's fairly priced, THIS IS IT! And under $200, was a steal!!PROS:~Easy interface~Great graphics, including video.~Good sound (I'm not listening to music all the time though)~Solid~Expandable to 32GB~Not a lot of "bloat"ware pre-loaded!~Able to download apps from not just android market but others~Good Wi-Fi speedCONS:~Front facing ONLY camera (a bit weird, but I don't really need it as a camera, my phone is 8mp)~Freezing when battery is low (quick fix with reset button)~No "accessories" other than carrying case~Proprietary plug~Navigation keys aren't raised & go dark after a few seconds when on same page for some time, making it a little difficult to hit correct key when you're in the dark.I have yet to update the firmware. The company posted instructions & on the first day, they were very confusing, but they have since updated them & seems to be easier than I thought. I did call the company, had to leave a message, but I did hear back from them that same day. Also made 2 "cases" after registering my tablet on their website & have very quick responses from them (both were also reason I called). I haven't tried skype yet, but there are plenty of others that have given advice on how to fix that problem. (I also have it on my phone, so not too big of a deal for me).I wanted something to email, browse web, & keep kids entertained while out & about. This exceeds those capabilities! I even downloaded a texting app & can text from it, instead of using my phone!I didn't give it 5 stars because of the older OS, difficulty updating the firmware & the freezing. I would have given it 4.5, but that wasn't an option.I'm glad I got it before they were out of stock! Originally bought from Amazon with 2 day shipping, but there was delay & wasn't going to get it until after xmas, so canceled & got it from Walmart. (Walmart added tax & a special fee)If you're on the fence & don't have a lot of $ to spend, or worried because you have small kids . . .this is the tablet for you!! My kids love it!! & so do I!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful tablet
Reviews.Author: Justin H
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to say that the le pan tablet pc is one of the best tablets I have seen. I am an android power user and I am here to say that this tablet is very well built and its functionality exceeds expexctations. When I first purchased this device I was skeptical bc le pan is a lesser known manufacturer. I love the HD display, the multi touch is great and comes in handy, has haptic feedback and as a plus u can sideload 3rd party apps such as amazon app store. The User Interface is very fast and fluid I have not experienced any lag. I have read several reviews about the power button. The power button on my tablet is not flush with the tablet it is slightly raised up so pressing it is a cinch. Speakers on the tablet are HD which means crystal clear sound with good depth of sound.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: WilJ "WilJ"
Reviews.Content: I have had the Le Pan II for three days and am very happy with it. The performance is very good and the appearance is quite attractive. The screen quality is better than expected and the overall features of the tablet are a great value for the money.No longer a great value due to all of the new products on the market, this is a functional tablet but does not compare to the Google Nexus 7, that I also have.

Reviews.Title: Exciting
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for what you get. Powerful. Easy to handle. Quick set up. Everything I expected to get and more.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: I have never heard of Le Pan before but I bought it because it's got a good price with seemingly good specs. After playing around with it, I'm totally in love with it. I am not a big tech person so pardon my descriptions if it sounds amateur.The pros:First of all very affordable.The interface is nice and clean and it runs apps smoothly.Stunning picture quality, crisp and sharp from all angles.Very easy to access everything and easy to configure, as expected from an Android system.Great touch sensitivity and responsiveness.Definitely a big plus on battery life.The cons:Some lagging occurs but rarely and when it does, it is not to a point that it will bother whatever you are doing.The speakers could be better, it's got too much static-y sound and it's quite uncomfortable to listen to when it's pumped up to maximum.The back of the unit gets dirtied up very easily, but not a big deal.Overall this is a great tablet with little flaws in my opinion. I will definitely suggest this to friends and family because I love it!~

Reviews.Title: Slow WiFi.... So what's the point??
Reviews.Author: M. tolentino
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:::::: After spending more time the other day with the tablet despite the wifi performance issues I noticed another problem... screen "bleeding"!  I know it's common to see a bit of light leakage but my tablet had significant light leaking from 3 sides.  I obviously never noticed it before since I could hardly do anything without a stable wifi connection but last night i tried watching a movie and it is very distracting especially on a black background.to make things worse there is a 15% restocking fee at online retailer i bought the tablet from.  now i'm stuck on whether to send the tablet in to Le Pan under warranty and likely wait forever to get it back or just get rid of it and deal with the 15% fee. :::::::::::::::::UPDATEFirst of all I really wanted to keep the Le Pan II based on the features you get at a great price.  Like others, I also work in IT and have tested the tablet on numerous Wifi networks and settings.  My main problem is the slow and inconsistent data speeds.  The wifi connection is strong and will stay connected but the data speeds are terrible.  So you can imagine anything from web browsing, youtube, facebook, or anything that requires data is painfully slow.For testing purposes I was lucky enough to have two (2) Le Pan II tablets on hand.  I also tested and compared the Le Pan's with a Nook Color (rooted), Ipad and a HP Touchpad (Rooted, running android).  I basically ran simple speed tests and comparisons on Web Browsing, Streaming Videos, etc.  Unfortunately the Le Pan's almost always came in last.  It would either hang, buffer or keep you waiting and waiting.  Even the Nook Color had a better browsing experience (speed wise).Don't get me wrong, the Le Pan II has alot going for itself especially considering the features at an awesome price.  But what's the point of owning a tablet if you can't get anything done online?As a side note, I've also tried dealing with Le Pan's customer support.  I tried calling numerous times and could never get a "live" person.  I tried e-mailing both the customer service and and support e-mails found on their website to no avail.  I've also opened "tickets" via their website and am yet to receive a response or reply.I'm pretty sure a simple firmware update can fix the WiFi issues but since customer support is almost non-existant, who knows when?

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: St. Mark Lion Rock
Reviews.Content: Great hardware and performance. I love the viewing angle - this is a plus for my sons to watch each other play games . Most happy with performance, stability and easy to use. Download lots of online app. from amazon store. Battery life is great! I get the 10 hours for normal usage.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding! One small glitch
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews with wifi issues and streaking bleedover in the corners. I do not have any of these issues. My Le Pan II is running great. Outstanding little toy. Fantastic price. Paid $250 for it on pre order. Price has now jumped to $300. I have an IPad. With Android 3.2 the Le Pan keeps up with my IPad. It has been designed to be upgradeable when the next Android upgrade comes out. You just can't beat it for $250.

Reviews.Title: In love with my Le Pan tablet
Reviews.Author: linmoncha
Reviews.Content: In the beginning, I did hesitate since it's an out of nowhere brand and there're bunch of similar tablets on the search list. But after read through all the comments I decided why not give it a try. Especially this tablet has a 4:3 ratio display screen from a commonly used 16:9 scale on the market which is exactly what I am looking for.Well...after 2 weeks getting along with my le pan tablet, I have to admit its performance is amazingly way more than what I expected at first place. The screen is no doubt reaching my most satisfaction, big, vivid on the color, great sensitivity and easy to use. And also it's capable of handling multi-task without slowing down; I can watch online movies, view/share my images, do website browsing, check my emails and chatting with my friends at same time. It's a true pleasure using it honestly! Right now I don't even have to open my desktop pc and I can have my entertainment and routines done without any problem.There are indeed some imperfections on the tablet. The most dissatisfaction to me will be the storage space is little beyond the standard on the market although it is upgradable up to 32GB capacity. . It'll be great if it equip with one 8GB SD card from my point of view.But overall, I love it and i will keep using it as my portable entertainment device.

Reviews.Title: Cheap in price and quality.
Reviews.Author: Crystal Abert
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a year ago for Christmas. I read tons of reviews, but the price was so little that I chose to purchase. I don't hate this product but I do wish I would've waited and not purchased it. I wish I would've saved my money for a better tablet.Pros: It was cheap and easy to use. It is a cool design and has a nice screen. it is durableCons: Freezes a lot! Watching youtube videos is impossible. Freezes in the middle of videos and you have to reset the device.battery life is alright not the best. Apps run slow.

Reviews.Title: I was leary, lot of specs for the buck, seemed too good to be true...
Reviews.Author: brett sharp
Reviews.Content: I wasn't even so sure it was a good deal once we got it and tried it. It took a bit and I'm not sure why, but once it had been on and the tablet updated Google's play store, this thing is great, it looks nice, works well, runs everything we have tried. If I have to find a problem I'd say I do not like the switch that shuts off the auto rotation. It seems too easy to jostle if you don't have a case on it... I was afraid to buy this, I'd buy another, at least as of now. What more can I say, pleasantly surprised...I'll be blunt, if I could by an I pad or the big Samsung Galaxy tab, for this price, I would, but since they cost several times more expensive, I'm happy with this.I've had minor issues, but I'm geeky enough to have straightened them out without tech support. I am saying I find it a good value... I'm just trying to be abundantly clear... hence the update.

Reviews.Title: Best price and value for such a LARGE tablet!
Reviews.Author: ksp
Reviews.Content: Surpassed my expectations!  Great price, great product, great deal!  Upgraded to ICS in about 20 minutes and havent looked back since.  Would buy this product again if I needed another one.  Love it.Screen is larger then imagined; the tablet is super responsive and the graphics are as great or even better then that of the Ipad.  I purchased the Le Pan 2 tablet, 32gb Micro-sd card, tablet case and screen protector all for less then HALF of the cost of an Ipad.If your questioning this product due to its lack of notoritiy, please dont.  This is a great product and the ONLY thing holding it back in any way is its lack of familuarity in name.I expect this company to continue to do great things and build on its reasonably priced products... if I could buy stock in Le Pan I would.

Reviews.Title: great tool!
Reviews.Author: Leti
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by this product! I have seen IPAD and Samsung Galaxi but when I start using Le Pan I can tell you that you won't regreat of your purchase! and is so much cheaper than other brands.Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Not a good product
Reviews.Author: Jules
Reviews.Content: The LePan tablet quit working after having it a short time, we ordered a replacement. The replacement one didn't even turn on.  We upgraded to a samsung galaxy tablet 2.

Reviews.Title: Sorry I Purchased This Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Deborah C. Ormond "dw1958"
Reviews.Content: I've had this device since January 2012.  In March 2012, Le Pan replaced the unit because it was defective.I thought the replacement unit would work flawlessly.  I was wrong.  It has a big problem as far as I am concerned.  I can not watch HD videos on Youtube.  When I attempt to watch HD Youtube video the tablet just buffers, and buffers, and buffers.  The buffering issue is so annoying I just give up trying to watch the video, search for another video, get more annoying buffering, etc., and never get the experience of viewing HD Youtube video on the tablet!  Now, if I watch non-HD video (film quality of non-HD is horrible) I am forced to watch super poor quality, fuzzy looking film.I used to be thrilled about this tablet.  My view of this tablet has taken a 180 degree turn in the opposite direction.  I do not recommend this tablet at all.  I thought by saving money and choosing this cheaper tablet I got a great deal.  I was wrong.  Next tablet I buy is going to be an Ipad.  Apple produces reliable devices.

Reviews.Title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the third tablet I've purchased, largely on the strength that it's Google certified against the Play store.  I had an Acer Iconia that I wound up giving to my father in law.  I purchased a Nook Tablet and returned it after a week.  This?  It's actually replaced the numerous laptops and Kindles around the domicile as my primary information consumption device.  It's not perfect.  Sometimes Flash buffering is quirky, and there are a number of apps that just plain don't work, usually obscure games I don't care about.  I really miss having Swype, which is apparently incompatible due to the screen form factor.  I think in the end, why I like it so much is because of the form factor.  9.7 inches is just right for holding in one hand while having easy readability and UI spacing, and it's all without Apple's suffocating user experience.  The biggest advantage over the 7" form factor?  PDFs.  I go to a lot of conferences with materials in PDF format, and seven inches is not going to cut it.  I move documents and e-books into my Dropbox on any PC and it opens with zero fuss seconds later.  Try that with iOS.  I've had an iPhone, Android phones, and even a terrible XP tablet at work back in the day.  Using this is a pleasure, and you get a lot of bang for your buck.UPDATE 7/30/2012Upgraded to the official Android 4.0.4 release a couple of weeks ago.  Still have access to the Google Play store, and still pleased as punch.  It runs somewhat faster, battery life lasts a LOT longer, and a number of app issues that existed under Honeycomb have been fixed.  A free Swype analogue is too be had with TouchPal Keyboard.  I've been comparing it to the iPad 2s some folks have at work, and wouldn't trade it for a second.  The advantage of DropBox and its local LAN sync plus custom third party apps over the iOS world really cannot be overstated.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: DAC
Reviews.Content: The LePanII tablet is a brand I have passed over not knowing it's origins etc, however after seeing a demo on a shopping show I relized it had features others do not. After further research I made the purchase through Amazon.Most other vendors were out of stk do to very high demand!! I recieved one with the newest update (v.118) and have had no problems.Pros: under $300.00,large 9.7 in screen,only one camera...(I prefer none), has SDcard slot, internal memory, latest honeycomb andriod 3.2 upgradable soon to ICS and probably more as I use it.Cons: None so far. I'm new to tablets and andriod so I think it's great.The LePanII at it's low price point is not plastic. It has an aluminum housing with chrome rails on both sides...

Reviews.Title: Exellent tablet can be as good as iPad 2 but half of the price
Reviews.Author: Mike ZH "Mike ZH"
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad 2 too. I would say I am very happy about my Le Pan II. It is almost as good as iPad 2 after I added 32G microSD. Only time having a problem was its restarting hanging ( caused by a downloded waterfall app used for desktop wallpaper) - have to press the reset using a pin - please do not follow some people's suggestion to restore to factory default.  After uninstall the app, the tablet never have a problem to turn on/off.  The Le Pan II can provide everything I need like my iPad2, I don't turn on my laptop often now. Overall, I am very happy about it, can't live without it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: GARY
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about this tablet and looking forward to getting it. My excitement soon turned to frustration when I couldn't get it to connect with the Verizon network using my 4G Mobile router. It would connect to public hot spots. My desktop, laptop and Nook connect but the Le Pan would not. Le Pan's Support was not any help. They gave me a one sentence answer to my email. I took the tablet to the Verizon store along with my mobile router to see if they could get it to work but no one could. Consequently, I had to return the Le Pan  and ordered a iPad.The Le Pan is a really nice tablet at a good price, but it's not much good if can't connect.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet For The Money!!
Reviews.Author: Hawaii Lover
Reviews.Content: I have had my LePan II for over three months now and have had very little problems. For my purposes, it is a very nice tablet. I check my emails, surf the internet, and have downloaded games and other apps. I wasn't crazy about the volume rocker and downloaded volume in notification from the Play Store. Works great.....no more fiddling with the volume rocker! I have found a couple of games that downloaded fine but didn't load....Temple Run was one of them. Bummer! Not sure if it's the tablet or the app. I also have transferred movies and music from my notebook to the tablet and they play fine. You may have to check around the Play Store for the best video players to play your movies .........some will play one format smoothly but not the other. I have a 32gb micro sd card for storage which really makes enjoying the tablet nice.For the time I've have it, I have had to reset it twice. I never had a wi-fi problem but since the v118 update it sometimes disconnects after being in sleep mode a long time. At first I panicked but now neither of these two things turned out to be a big deal (so far) to me.  I just either re-connected to wi-fi or powered down and restarted. The only thing I'm waiting for now is the HDMI cable to be available and the HDMI option to re-appear back in settings.I know people are concerned about the upgrade to ICS. I'm not familiar with ICS so I don't know how much the upgrade will improve the performance of the LePan II.  For the time being Honeycomb has fulfilled most of my needs.Check out the Le Pan Life Forum for a ton of info on the LePan. Overall, a nice tablet for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Sleek - handy but limited - no upgrades make it DISPOSABLE soon obsolete
Reviews.Author: QAWeb
Reviews.Content: Googling for MONTHS for how to solve "phone errors", or find any "official" support - the best source for info has been Amazon reviews!  Am writing this review after hunting down the OEM and receiving their email below the six points here:Indeed this device is clean, sleek and 35% cheaper than an Acer, Asus (or iPad).By saving $100, you also: 0. Save a digital tree - ABSOLUTELY NO MANUAL -PRINTED, NOR PDF, NOR by website. 1. Lose ability to use Google Chrome for Android - restricted by Gmail / Google from using their full features.  (highly recommend Firefox *and* Opera browsers) 2. Have no option to ever upgrade - see manufacturer's email below saying they plan to replace/obsolete this item 3. Experience "phone errors" - giving strong indication the Operating System is cloned from a phone 4. If a student of Japanese or other Asian languages, will have have difficulty installing alternate keyboard.  You can change the entire keyboard easily, but to switch to second entry method, more difficult than any competitor I've seen. (Certainly LePan's OEM, having a Chinese website and Japanese name, should be experts at this.) 5A. Gain a reliable email collection / response tool for public WiFi hotspots like Panera, Starbucks, Peet's, Whole Foods, and McDonald's - It is SO VERY PLEASANT to be able to type on a full keyboard instead of the tiny iphone keyboard 5B. Become a WiFi troubleshooting expert: this reviewer could ONLY connect with WEP key - the oldest, and simplest WiFi security / encryption method. It would recognize the more robust AES and TKIP methods but alternately connect/disconnect every 10-15 seconds. Solution was to reduce my router's WiFi security to WEP - and gain full connectivity!! 6. Lose points with your teenager - I offered this to him and he rejected it - says he'll save up for a real pad like Acer, Asus or iPad. Visited Matsunichi dot com - this device is nowhere mentioned. Reviews.Title: The best tablet i ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Robert Clark
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet to replace a cheap china made tab called a mica tablet that I paid all most $200.00 bucks for.I didn't realize I could of bought a kindle fire for what I paid for the cheapy. I almost bought the fire but I came across Le pan 2.After I did some research for about two months, I decided to give a try.I am so glad I did.This tablet kicks @$$.I needed a dual core device that was fast and powerful. I am a beat maker who is always on the go and needed something to run Caustic and Supreme Mpa music production apps on.The Le pan can run both apps at the same time without a hickup,glitch or laging.It has sturdy solid feel,no cheap plastic here,super fast,great touch responce,excellent size,shape and profile.Over all a really great product.If people are having wifi problems their is a update that just got released today by Le pan.I just downloaded it and it is for the wifi fix and blue tooth.I got the update from a forum site just for Le pan tablet owners.Here is the web site [...]  They also have a 30 pin to HDMI cable coming in may or June.ICS will be released in may.Remember they are a new company and people need to give them time for fixes and accessories. I did not purchase the le pan 2 from amazon because I didn't want to wait a month to receive it,so I purchased from Newegg.

Reviews.Title: Negatives Generally Outweighed by Positives
Reviews.Author: Alcee Arobin
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively reliable and affordable device, but one that's a bit frustrating if you're used to working with Apple touch technology.  The iPhone touch recognition/sensitivity has always been seamless for me, which makes it all the more annoying when the Le Pan tablet freezes or jumps a command when you're performing basic tasks.  When you rearrange icons or slide the touch bar to unlock the device, for instance, it's not a smooth movement, and tends to stick.But as far as essential functionality goes, it's been more convincing.  The internet and all applications work perfectly; the webcam is decent quality for the price; and the speakers and sound system are likewise acceptable.  The display is really beautiful, so no complaints there either.Originally I thought this would be great to use with Netflix's online streaming.  Unfortunately the Netflix app doesn't work with this device, so that was a fail.  On the bright side it does play Flash videos so it's much easier to watch videos associated with news articles and the like than with Apple's technology (or, confession: South Park Studios . com).

Reviews.Title: Very, very pleased
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Bunge
Reviews.Content: Although there seems to be some variation unit-to-unit (my wife has one and seems to have occasional Wifi issues), I am very pleased with this product. At a fraction of the price, it does exactly what I need it to (key when you're buying -- be sure you define your needs) and looks great doing so. I believe there's been a subsequent model, but I don't have a reason to upgrade yet. Definitely would buy another Le Pan product.

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY
Reviews.Author: sbssis1
Reviews.Content: BROKE AFTER A WEEK OF USE. CONTACTED COMPANY OVER AND OVER AND NEVER GOT A RESPONSE. I REVIEW HONESTLY (LOOK AT MY HISTORY). FAIR WARNING, I STILL HAVE IT BUT IT IS STILL BROKE IN IT'S CASE. WON'T CHARGE, TURN ON, ANYTHING

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS TABLET
Reviews.Author: kalikat
Reviews.Content: I ordered it...it worked for 4 months and then went black and DEAD...I've not been waiting3.5 months to get it replaced....NOT RECOMMENDED TO WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very happy customer.
Reviews.Author: Pegge Marjamaa "pegge Marjamaa"
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love, my Le Pan.  It is so versatile in uses.  I can read books on it, I can shop, play games, just about do anything with it that I can with my PC, but I have more comfort and mobility with the Le Pan.

Reviews.Title: I swear I thought I reviewed this.
Reviews.Author: Warwelf
Reviews.Content: Actually I might have been reviewing it on my Le Pan I when it decided to stop working for the 327th time, in which case my review was lost forever.Don't buy this.  I mean, the fact that you CAN'T buy it on Amazon anymore should put a damper on that, but if you happen to be searching for reviews before buying it from someplace else (like a guy in a van who is also selling meat and stereos) keep in mind that this thing fails on so many levels it's mind-bottling.  (Not mind-boggling, I mean it practically converts your mind into diet cola and bottles it.)One entire side of the screen stopped responding to touch input.  The reset switch (the one accessed through a hole on the back of the thing) stopped working.  It took maybe five tries to get my flash card to get recognized, and occasionally it would stop showing up, making the tablet useless until it decided to start working again.  The battery's connection to the board is awful so it occasionally stops charging and you have to open the thing to reconnect it.  The power button isn't soldered to the main board very well so some owners (such as my lucky self) have had to bust out our soldering irons or reflow tools to fix it.  Le Pan's technical support for the thing was utterly nonexistent even when the thing was the only product they made, and now they appear to have forgotten the thing ever existed at all.  The only high note was that it set my standards for tablets so incredibly low that my new Jelly Bean-running tablet seems like a cross between Superman and the Messiah.Oh, and speaking of Android versions, Le Pan once stated that the 2.2-running TC 970 would be upgradeable to newer versions.  And technically they were telling the truth, but only because they apparently considered "buying a newer model of tablet" to be upgrading.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Wesley C.
Reviews.Content: I got mine a year and a half ago. Battery power is still great and no problems with system. This tablet does everything I need. I bought a 30 pin to HDMI cable for it and watch HD Netflix on my TV everyday. Le Pan ii is a great high quality tablet at a great low price. I will definitely be buying another Le Pan when I upgrade.The only down side I've found on this tab is it has no rear facing camera and the front facing camera does not have auto focus. Though that has never bothered me because I don't use the camera anyway.I highly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Embeeous
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap Android tablet so I could sit with the kids playing on iPads and have a similar experience.  I got what I paid for, it works, most of the time.  Poor battery life and WiFi issues are a regular occurrence, but you can't beat the price on a full sized tablet.  Not a big Android fan c/c to iOS devices but certainly worth the try and I feel like it was worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: fast and has andriod
Reviews.Author: Danielle Robling
Reviews.Content: i will say at first the tablet was having trouble, but i think it was because it still needed to sync and update but after that it works perfect has a nice bright screen, its fast, andriod market, and cheap price

Reviews.Title: had a lot of problems
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Ortiz
Reviews.Content: first couple months were great. the power button broke, but that wasn't a big deal. if you have any soldering skills, you can fix it in a flash. the operating system, memory, and storage space only allow for basic operation. i can read books, answer emails, and shop online, which is nice, but if i could do it again, i'd spend a little more money and upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Good.
Reviews.Author: Eunice I. Guban de Gomez
Reviews.Content: Very good tablet. Works well but be very very careful when plugging and unplugging the usb/charging cable as the connection is not of the best design. The outer pins (used for charging) on mine are already damaged and now only charges as usb, which takes forever.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "steve"
Reviews.Content: I used Le Pan II for almost everything from reading e-mail, Kindle books, to play games. I also took an online class and usedKing Office to do my projects and post my work. It never crashed or gave me any problems.I have now given this to my mother for her to read e-mail on instead of regular computer. So far she is loving it as well.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Donald T.
Reviews.Content: was looking for a tablet came across the le pan ll and it those everything i needed it to and much more

Reviews.Title: Dont waste your money
Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: This tablet does not play videos or stream well. Is not durable at all and ais a waste of your money.

Reviews.Title: I do love it!
Reviews.Author: Norma Geeves
Reviews.Content: I bought my Le Pan 2 years ago as a Xmas special.  Couldn't afford an Ipad.I'm totally not a techy (almost a senior citizen) so need intuitive e-devices.(I have an Iphone which I like very much.)Recently I've been downloading some new apps including Go-Launcher & myLe Pan works like a charm.  Visuals & colours are awesome. Video chat I don'tuse - don't want to frighten people.  Netflix isn't perfect... moving objects mayblur momentarily yet I'm a movie buff & have enjoyed a lot of flix.  No biggie.All in all, it just works very well.  Battery life is excellent.  Apps download quickly.Lots of helpful options on the menu.  Very sturdy construction.  There is a manualonline & fellow users offer great tips as well.  Have never needed to call support sono thoughts there.It does take a bit of exploring and curiosity (patience) to learn the ropes but whenyou do, it's delightful!  I'm so glad I bought it!  Also - Can't beat the price ($179)!THIS REVIEW IS FOR LE PAN I 970TC, not Le Pan II.

Reviews.Title: Great Product Great Service
Reviews.Author: Rick Evans
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these 3 years ago and it's still working great. I bought a new on for my sister.The new OS took some getting used to but after a while, it was easy.Battery life is great, speed is great too.I would recommend this tablet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Service with Le  Pan sucks
Reviews.Author: S. D. Singleton
Reviews.Content: Trying to send the item back for service is a pain.  Even with the service plan.  Instead of just requesting the tablet back they make you jump through hoops.  I bought another tablet through Walmart and the service was astronomically much easier. I won't buy another Le Pan based on the service they provide.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product.
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: Its the same color as appears on the monitor. I like it a lot ! the first day i got it everyone complimented my tablet. Its really good for search information. The only thing i wish, was that it had a little handle to wrap around my wrist. Its good and the seller shipped it here in IN in an ample amount of time.

Reviews.Title: good tablet but didn't last for me...
Reviews.Author: ddk
Reviews.Content: Great tablet.  Worked great for a while. The weak link on this amazing tablet for me was the charge port.  It was a long thin slot instead of a mini usb or other similar connector.  Over time the receiving end in the tablet became damaged and the tablet is now useless as it can no longer be charged.  Bottom line- it was good while it lasted.

Reviews.Title: Bummer
Reviews.Author: cmcook3
Reviews.Content: The tablet works fine.  I have no issues with the hardware or screen.  It will turn on automatically when the recharger is inserted.  I don't like that, off should be off.  Support is dysfunctional, don't expect any future upgrades to the Android.

Reviews.Title: Really good tablet but
Reviews.Author: Brent Caldoron
Reviews.Content: the battery stop charging after 4 months so now this tablet is a is useless it have to be plug in to the charge to work and that sucks i really liked it now i don't because i am going to have to spend money on a next tablet

Reviews.Title: Old but Still Good.
Reviews.Author: nuismer
Reviews.Content: This Tablet is getting dated now, but I think it still holds up well against the more current tablets.  Has a great IPS screen.  Is still reasonably fast and full of features.

Reviews.Title: Great Video, Great AV Playback, Bad Microphone 4 Recording
Reviews.Author: Wordess Benita
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my Le Pan tablet. I feel let down by the makers though. They promised when they released this product that the Android OS would be upgradeable for free. Then they changed their minds. They should have at least done a DEEP discount, I'm talking the retail price for Le Pan 1, allowing registered owners to upgrade to Le Pan 2. The main reason I am reselling my tablet is I need to record for work. The microphone in the tablet is pitiful. It is of such low quality it isn't usable. I can't even Skype with it which is a far lower standard than what I need. The cheap mic would be forgivable if an external mic could be used. No such luck. No such upgrade.Otherwise the optics on this thing are fantastic! Gaming should be super fun. (I don't game.) I've been able to download Google apps and use them regularly. It connects to wifi easily. CAVEAT: Down try wiping and resetting because it retains the info for the original registrant even when you press factory reset. So, if you access secure information on the tablet you may want to strongly consider if you will ever want to resell.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan I Outstanding Tablet!! (Black Friday 2012 Deal)
Reviews.Author: S. Brower "Kitty Keeper"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Le Pan I tablet during the Black Friday shopping frenzy in 2012. So I've had this for almost a year and I am very impressed! This is my second tablet, the first was a no-name piece of junk purchased on eBay for about $100 - it was returned. This Le Pan I tablet is 180 degrees from the other one and I highly recommend it! The battery lasts a very long time, vivid graphics, excellent touch sensitivity, responsive, fast, reliable, even really good sound!!

Reviews.Title: The Le Pan is great!.
Reviews.Author: Chuck Hendrickson
Reviews.Content: This is my third one, the second one was stolen. My main problem is that when I turn it off and close the lid on the case it fires back up. Help!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Douglas Paredes
Reviews.Content: I like this product. this  le pan II 9.7 Tablet met my requirements. This product is highly recommended for me.

Reviews.Title: Ask yourself the question "Why am I buying a tablet?"
Reviews.Author: SirHutson
Reviews.Content: I have had my LePan for about 3 years now.  I had an iphone, I didn't want an Ipad because i felt like it was more of the same. I wanted the freedom of Android on my tablet.  When I saw the price tag on this tablet, i was weary. But, it was so cheap i had to find out for myself.  Here is a list of things that i have found to dislike about my TC-970.1. The tablet is running Android 2.2 "Froyo" that is the best it will ever do... period.2. Nothing is optimized for a tablet. It thinks it is a large phone with no service. apps are streched out or run in a small window...3. The volume down button broke about 9 months into owning it. (there is a volume slider in the settings so that isn't much of a hassle, however you have to use the volume buttons if you ever need to do a factory reset or upgrading firmware... I cannot do that anymore because i cant press "down" to select factory reset.4. For some reason after an extended time, the date/time goes out of sync and web pages and youtube and netflix stop working for "security certificate validation".  Again, easily fixable but annoying.5. The speakers are horrendous... Im talking TERRIBLE. and im not some audiophile who nitpicks. Sounds like the speakers are left over from an old speak-and-spell.So, ask yourself "Why am i buying a tablet?" If anything i have listed above seems like it should be something a tablet should do better. Find something else.

Reviews.Title: TABLET
Reviews.Author: Linda  Rogers
Reviews.Content: I AM STILL TRYING TO EDUCATE MYSELF ON USING, I AM NOT  USE TO THIS TECHNOLOGY.  WISH IT CAME WITHBOOKLET EASIER FOR ME TO LEARN

Reviews.Title: Fantastic...
Reviews.Author: Optimus913
Reviews.Content: Tablets for anything you might need it for.  Myself and my wife love watching Netflix or Skyping with our daughter and son.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy Ever!!
Reviews.Author: Sandra Wallgren
Reviews.Content: This tablet it awesome, sleek, and works great. I love it and would definitely recommend it to my family and friends. I also got my husband use to it, and now he wants one!!!

Reviews.Title: Strange design
Reviews.Author: Andrey Frolov
Reviews.Content: Finding volume control without looking at side of the device is a quest.Charger connector is very strange to have on Android tablet(why not just use microUSB?)Inserting memory stick is another quest. The slot for it is loose and not that easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: i love my tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Everyone in my house got a tablet. I got this one and everyone else got something different. I like mine best.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Douglas Cedeno Ramirez
Reviews.Content: Just a little thing, it comes without charge! so it's freaking scary the first time you tri to power on!

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Janet  A Herrington
Reviews.Content: My Grandson loves this tablet. His cousins had one & he begged for one for his birthday. We got it & the 1st week he had a problem with it, not being able to accessing his password. Called technical support & they were great & helped to fix the problem over the phone. Two weeks later the on/off button quit working & he had to reset every time to get it to come on. Now it is just dead. Will not take a charge or anything. Have been trying for 3 days now to get an rma # from Le Pan without success. Tried online--no response. Called the # instructions say to call & they said I have to send a request by email--which is what I did online per instructions. Still no rma #. Amazon will only take it back and give a partial refund because it is over 30 days since purchased.Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II android tablet
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my wife and she just love it. It is a lot faster than the older Le Pan that I bought. They both are good tablets. Good for web and the apps are great. Easy to use. We do a lot of bible study and use it at church instead of the regular bible or my cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect experience
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: Total worth to buy. size like ipad 2, but price is far less.System is fast. Image is good as notebook. Lots of functions to use.Worth to buy.

Reviews.Title: Functional for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had my tablet for about 6 weeks. It worked perfectly in the beginning as I only needed to charge it about every other day or so. Since I have a 2 year old, it gets a fair amount of use and he loves it. The wireless receiver is pretty good. I haven't had any issues with dropped signals unless I am at the very edge of the access point's range. I have downloaded apps from both the Google Play Store and Amazon Appstore without incident. Any apps that have malfunctioned were faulty to begin with. I mostly use it for Facebook, Twitter, email, job searching, and a few games before bed. It's pretty decent if that's all you plan to use it for.One thing I don't like about this version is that the battery doesn't seem to last all that long. After six weeks I'm having issues with it not having a consistent charge or sudden fluctuations. Also, if you like Hulu, it is not supported on this version. Youtube works fine if you don't use Chrome (no Flash support so I use Firefox).For the most part, I do like the Le Pan II. It was a replacement after my first tablet (Le Pan S) was damaged. It serves its purpose and is very responsive like the specs say. I could live with it if the Hulu Plus app was supported. If Hulu is a must, go with the Le Pan S. Otherwise, this version should serve you well.

Reviews.Title: Happy with just one complaint
Reviews.Author: Jenifer Crowl
Reviews.Content: I wish it had a general USB cors attachment as opposed to the unique one it does.  Besides that, We love it and our daughter uses it ALL the time :)

Reviews.Title: had to write
Reviews.Author: aggie
Reviews.Content: I bought the LePan tablet Sept., 2012 for a Christmas gift.  It worked well and was happy with the tablet.  In March charging the unit became more difficult. In May the unit had to be sent back to the company because itstopped working and would not charge, as it was still under warranty.  The company will not send me out a new unit, I have to wait 4 weeks before I get a replacement tablet.  The customer service is not customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: whitney
Reviews.Content: This is a great android tablet.  It works with Kindle and nook.  Only problem I had was a manufacturer defect so sent it back to Le Pan for replacement....they lost it and have been nothing but rude to me.  I have tracking number with person who signed for it so now it's a waiting game to see if I'll get another tablet or nothing at

Reviews.Title: Gift for someone else
Reviews.Author: Darlene Lou
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for soeone else, and they have used it a lot and have really really enjoyed it.  would do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: vincesanity
Reviews.Content: This is such a great tablet. Maybe even better than an iPad. The only bad thing is that it has no back camera, but overall its a five star tablet. Get it while you can!

Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "freefarid"
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these tablets, $150 each. They are extraordinary in terms of functionality and affordability. It can do whatever an average user would like to do such as browsing websites, using it as a communication device(you can send emails, texts, pictures or call someone using Skype, Magic Jack app, Google Talk, etc) watching videos, playing games, using it as a GPS, and even create/edit/save MS Office files. My only dissatisfaction about this tablet is its support. Their support site is not dynamic and is almost one way communication.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: SuesAna
Reviews.Content: This tablet is fast and has a lot of features. The volume is loud and clear. It's affordable. The only con is that the battery time is short but it does charge fast.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet
Reviews.Author: Carlos Brito
Reviews.Content: Very nice and fast. I havent used that much, but so far so good. I recommended it for the price.

Reviews.Title: It's a great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: It actually does almost everything that a IPad does but at a lower cost. I bought one for myself last year and loved it so much I bought a second one for a gift. It's easy to use, easy to download apps, easy to buy anything. For a great 9.7" tablet, you need to get this one.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II 9.7" Tablet, Ice cream sandwich
Reviews.Author: PLittle
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this tablet and I was not dissapointed at all. I believe I got more than I bargined for, in a good way. Since I'm new at this I didn't want to spend alot, so when recieved it I used it as much as possible and I still haven't used all it's features. Thanks, PLittle

Reviews.Title: Okay while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I loved this little tablet with all its quirks ~ freezing up often and loudly, turning on only with a paperclip... but then, after 8 months on this earth, it died. Bought a different tablet today. Wish me luck!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for a reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: Abdul Purnell Askew SR
Reviews.Content: This tablet has exceeded my expectations.  The screen is very bright and vibrant, its processor is very fast.  Video playback is excellent.  I find myself using this tablet for everything from surfing the web to creation of documents.  Another plus point is that is has Android ICS on it, which in my opinion is way better than the previous versions.  I like the metallic styling, seems more durable than the plastic casings most tablets have.  The touchscreen is very responsive &  quick.  The battery life is excellent, I can use it almost all day with a full charge, this include watching lots of videos.  I don't care too much for the camera on it,  it's lacking, but I dind't buy the tablet because of the camera so it's not a big disadvantage for me.  I was frustrated when I found out the difficulties involved with getting picasa albums to sync with the gallery, but once I got it to sync it's been no problems since.  I really don't know how I got it to sync, but I went into the gallery and saw that my picasa albums were synced.  The keyboard is also nice, its keys well space for my big fingers & paired with the very responsive touch screen make it second nature to type on, to me it feels almost like typing on my desktop keyboard.  I can't wait to find out the endurance of this tablet, I'm hoping it will last a long time.03/14/2014: After a year I'm still pleased with this purchase.  The tablet works just as good as it did when I got it.  The battery life is great, I use this tablet more than my PC.  My only gripe with it is sometimes it's slow to come out of sleep mode, other than that I'm overly pleased.  I'm thinking of purchasing about 3-4 more.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I love this thing.  The Le Pan Tablet is great.  It provides smooth operation, and the battery life is awesome.  I recommend this tablet to anyone that is looking to buy a tablet for a GREAT PRICE.  I can't get over how wonderful this device is. A+++++++++++

Reviews.Title: Does not turn on, regardless of troubleshooting procedures.
Reviews.Author: ERIC WALTER
Reviews.Content: Bought for Christmas. Constantly freezes or has issues powering up. Now it does not turn on, regardless of troubleshooting procedures I try. Rest button, etc...nothing works, including the tablet.DO NOT PURCHASE PIECE OF JUNK!!! Spend the extra money on a quality tablet!!!  BUYER BE WARNED!!!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: RHONDA MERTZ
Reviews.Content: I love it. Great value. Perfect for my family. I am not afraid to let the kids play with it. It was affordable so everyone can enjoy it. I have had no problems with it. I surf the web play games and do my bill pay and banking. lightweight and perfect for travel.

Reviews.Title: Worked about 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this product. I purchased it as a Christmas gift. Within a month the power button went out. Within 2 months it won't even charger or turn on any more. Since it was a gift my return window expired quickly and I'm now left with a junk product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome sturdy tablet
Reviews.Author: Kellee M. Mullin-Ertl "Kel Ertl"
Reviews.Content: Have only had this fora couple days but so far really love it.  Easy to type on the keyboard as if it were a regular PC keyboard. Fast processes, amazing picture display quality. Fast web surfing. Only downside is you have to load adobe flash player from here[...] since the play store doesn't carry it anymore. Don't download the a manual help apps because their loaded with viruses. Overall I would HIGHLY recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Got More Then Expected
Reviews.Author: Dr. WIL "Dr. William Conley Th.D., Ph.D."
Reviews.Content: I was not sure I would really like this product but from reading other reviews on here I thought I would give it a try - I sure am glad I did!This unit at times acts more like a PC then just an ordinary tablet PC. It easily reads Kindle books along with PDF files, surfs the Internet (built-in WiFi and Bluetooth), reads both Web-based and pop/smtp/IMAP email accounts, plays a wide assortment of games and is well integrated with most all Google, Firefox, Opera and IE browser features. Has speech recognition, built in mic & camera along with many other common tablet PC features.A friend of mine was visiting and played with my Le Pan II for a couple hours and told me his iPad does less then this unit does and he was going to trade it in and get a Le Pan II.Now the only thing left to try is see how it's longevity lasts.... I highly recommend this device!

Reviews.Title: fun for first 4 weeks
Reviews.Author: aleaxandrite
Reviews.Content: I bought the le pan and it broke within 4 weeks, freezes all the time i sent it in andthey gave me another for free. I desided to sell it on ebaywhat a peice of jnk!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Hate it
Reviews.Author: sciortinosr
Reviews.Content: Tablet keeps "Hanging up" very hard to use - wife really gets frustrated trying to play her card games on it.

Reviews.Title: IT'S DOESN'T WORK :0( !!!
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Perez
Reviews.Content: A GIFT FOR MY NIECE AND THE FIRST DAY GAVE PROBLEMS, IT IS CHANGED, BUT AFTER A MONTH ALSO GAVE THE NEW PROBLEMS, NOT CONNECTED TO THE INTERNET AND NEITHER CAN OPEN THE STORE TO PURCHASE APPLICATIONS.

Reviews.Title: one star rating is too much for this product
Reviews.Author: BARBARA
Reviews.Content: This is the worst product that I have purchased. It goes to the web page it wants to, turns on when it wants, is not at all consistant so that you can at least fgure out what went wrong. At times it is super sensitive to you touch other times you can pound on it and nothing happens. I can not send an email from my email account and most of the time I have to fight it to even access my email. I do not recommend this product to anyone. I almost paid nothing and that was too much.

Reviews.Title: Great value... for 6 months
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: This was a really good, somewhat simpler tablet--great for first time buyers or people who don't want to get something too fancy, but after 6 months of at best moderate use, the "hard buttons" on the right just totally stopped working for no reason at all (so  you can't back space or switch b/w apps, which pretty much renders it useless). After total reset, they still don't work and worse yet, even though it's under the 1-year warranty the company is horribly slow (like almost 2 weeks) at even responding to the email you have to send them just to get instructions to return it.  I'm even suspecting1-raspy voiced woman I talked to twice may be the only worker there!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Rachel Ranshaw
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a month and LOVE IT! It does everything I want it to and I saved $500 over buying an iPad. I can add memory cards which I love. It has the apps I wanted. I can download books and magazines and highlight, add notes, and underline. Great tablet and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Nakeisha
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet and it has been a great resource.  I listen to music a lot and there are many great apps.
