Reviews.Title: Everything the product claims to do, it does ... And does very well
Reviews.Author: Lee "Funkster"
Reviews.Content: I got the La Pan tablet a few months ago. I've also had my share of tablets from Archos to Playbook and let me tell you ... This is so far the best that I've experienced. The price and screen size makes it a plus. I'm not gonna get into a lot of detail as to why this is an exceptional Tablet, the product description does all that. But I will say this, everything the product claims to do, it does ... And does very well. If your looking for a really good Tablet without putting a dent in your wallet, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Greatest $200 Tablet on the Market
Reviews.Author: ClarkDee
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this tablet.  My wife got it for me for Christmas, and it has everything that I want.  The android software works really well, but occasionally it will freeze up.  If you have patience and wait, it will get back on track quickly.  It's only done this to me a few times, and it was right after I downloaded a bigger app.  The 2 mp camera on the front gives a high quality picture. The speakers are surprisingly good quality and give a good loud sound.  It has a 30 pin plug, the exact same as an Apple product.  Optional upgrade up to 32 gbs of memory via micro SD.All in all, you get the best bang for your buck out of this tablet.  It's no Apple iPad, but you get what you need and more.  My personal favorite feature over Apple is that I can watch ESPN3 on this.

Reviews.Title: Best thing since sliced bread
Reviews.Author: Gino A.
Reviews.Content: Have had this tablet for about two weeks and absolutely LOVE it. It has everything that I was hoping it would, does everything I want it to do and I personally couldn't be happier with my purchase. The screen is bright, clear and the clarity of images is outstanding. There are some that have said the on/off button was a problem, but I haven't really had that with mine. It "could" be bigger, but the size has not bothered me all that much.The users manual is pretty basic, but, still clear enough to get a person with moderate skills (practically none in my case) going with little effort. Granted the screen is a fingerprint magnet, but, there too, it hasn't been that big a deal.All in all, I am exceptionally happy with the tablet and also my purchase and look forward to many happy hours of use out of this little beauty. As someone on the "net" stated "you are getting 95% of the things the Ipad can do for less than half the price." What's not to like???

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Michael Enghusen
Reviews.Content: I've tried many lower priced tablets and the Le Pan beats them all! Long battery life, fast, Google App store and great screen. Sure it's not an Ipad, but for 40% of the price of one, it ain't bad!

Reviews.Title: Tablet Works for Me. Be careful though.
Reviews.Author: schrism
Reviews.Content: So far I think this tablet is great.  I can't compare it to other tablets because I've never used one, but so far I'm impressed.  It even has GPS and it works!  I only have a few minor issues so far. I pulled out the small cover to get to the SD card and couldn't get the cover seated back as securely as I'd like. In addition, be careful that that you actually turn the tablet off when you're done by pressing the On/Off button and it asks you if you want to power off. It seems that it will go into standby mode (you can set the timeout for this) but it looks as if it has turned off.  You have to push the On/Off button to get back in. I drained the battery by not doing this. (At least that's what I think happened.) I also don't know how to block websites that I don't want my children going to. I'm hoping there's a way to do this.If you noticed in the section above about other items to purchase, there is a USB keyboard for around $25.  Do Not Buy It!  I ordered it and when it came I noticed that it had a USB-A plug and the Le Pan has a 30-Pin port. (I did hook the keyboard up to my desktop and it didn't work well. See my review for it.) I thought that I might be able to use an adapter or converter to get around this, but I emailed Le Pan just to make sure.  I was extremely impressed that they replied in only 2-hours and politely.  Here is the reply:Unfortunately, external USB devices are not compatible with the TC970. If you wish to connect external devices, they must be bluetooth ready.  Thank you.So, at this time, I am very happy with the tablet and Le Pan's customer service.  Just be careful with accessories.

Reviews.Title: Great price, slightly slower than Ipad, battery life is poor, but totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Yang Zhang "Solutionate"
Reviews.Content: I've just got it and tested over the weekend, here are the issues.  I have an Ipad2 before I bought this.  I intend it to be used for watchin movies and for my kid to pay with.Negatives:1.  Not many accessories to choose from.2.  Battery life is not good compared to the Ipad 2.3.  Slower when playing movies, and sometimes there are hiccups if you touch the screen during playback.4.  A bit heavier than Ipad.  about 20% heavier.Positives1.  Android system, easy to get apps, and download movies directly to the Tablet without Itunes.2.  Price, and if you plan on using it less than 4 hrs a day, battery is ok.3.  Expandable Memory cards! Micro SD4.  Overall price/performance is better than IPAD2

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: paulo de tarso
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the quality of this tablet. It has a good screen resolution and is very easy to use. This is my first tablet and with the quick stat guide I promptly connected to internet and start navigation. I've already installed some apps from the android market - very easy instalation.The drawback is the mem. size - only 2GB, but one can buy separately a 32GB mem and still will be a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan Tablet
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: WOW, This is a great tablet. When you open the box it's all ready to go. The battery life is amazing. I charge it like every two days. Depending on how much I use it. It comes with the a lot of preloaded apps such as the google market. I did notice that I can't download angry birds, but I can download it thru using the amazon app (market). This tablet is just like my android phone, but without the phone dialer. I just love it. The only con that I have is the charging mechanism it just like the ipod changer. I've already kicked the cord and now the charging hole is a little loose. So be careful when charging it.

Reviews.Title: pretty good tablet _ well worthth money
Reviews.Author: HCD
Reviews.Content: Have had this unit about two weeks now and I love it. My wife has an iPad and I would say this compares favourbly.I have my ipod as well and while there are a few differences between the two systems I think the Android will become more popular in the end.Lots of apps available.A good buy.Quick shipping from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: excellent on all aspects but Wi-Fi connection
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: I just got the Le Pan 2 after waiting almost 1 month for it.Overall, Its a great build, great screen, great color and resolution, I can go on and on. It really is pretty impressive for the price if all aspects of the machine works well. the one i recieved however had a wifi connection issue.When I attempted to connect it registered that it had a good signal with my wi-fi device, but when it attemtped to connect....no go.i attempted several times through the day but it wouldnt work. My laptops connected fine and at quality speed so I was sure it was not the wi-fi device.The other odd factor was when the Le Pan was attempting to connect the laptops would get booted off.I wrote le Pan about the issue and their support was quick to respond. they sent me an email with in 6 hours stating I would have to send the product to them for repair/replacement. So for the support, I am impressed with the response time.In the fact that I waited a month and was highly excited to get the Le Pan 2 only to have one that didnt have a proper functioning connection capability, I am a bit disapointed about.With out reliable internet connection the tablet is not worth having.I am hoping I just recieved a defective device. If you do order one and the internet connection works well, then it is probably the best tablet you can get for the price.

Reviews.Title: The Truth!
Reviews.Author: wardell brown
Reviews.Content: Ipad whaaaaaaaaaat! This machine is a monster believe me, you won't go wrong buying one. I can't wait for Lepan 3 to come out!

Reviews.Title: Wifi Connectivity Issues
Reviews.Author: Lanfearz
Reviews.Content: This tablet seems to be blazing fast. However, on more than 4 different wifi networks I have only been able to get 150 kbps. That is incredibly slow and not nearly as slow as an N connection should be.  These are N routers and G routers. I tried three different brands.Hopefully you won't run into the same issue.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: len pan guru
Reviews.Content: I love this tabelt this is my second tablet that I buy the first one was for me and second for a gift better than IPod.

Reviews.Title: Good idea, poor execution
Reviews.Author: SMLTMS "smltms"
Reviews.Content: Well, I really wanted to like the tablet, so I have tried 3 of these units before buying an asus transformer 300. The first unit once all of a suddent would not power on -returned. The second unit had a broken power connector after a couple days of use - returned. Tried a third unit and compared it side by side to an asus transformer 300. What a difference for about a $100 more! The asus does everything faster and smoother, has HDMI out with 32Gb onboard memory plus 32Gb microsd. Think twice before buying this tablet.

Reviews.Title: WORST PRODUCT EVER
Reviews.Author: Roger Connolly
Reviews.Content: I am on my THIRD device and it is dead.  First had all kinds of problems.  Second went stone dead after a short amount of use, and would not boot regardless of recovery measures tried at the request of tech support.  Third device just arrived and died similarly after 1 day.  RUN AWAY.  Zero stars.

Reviews.Title: Very good bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: brad
Reviews.Content: So I Go this tablet on Saturday and was very exited. The second I picked it up I could tell it was mentioned to last. Its solid like a brick minus the weight. If you used to android then getting used to this is very simple. It has a terrific screen, interface, speakers and feel. I heard that lots of people had problems with the wifi on the previous update but with the v118 update I heard it went away. I don't know if this one came with it or not but I've been on wifi 24/7 and haven't had any problems yet. Another complaint I read about was the buttons on top. Volume is kinda hard to find but once you get the hang of it there's no problem. The power/ lock button is perfectly placed on the top right corner.(held landscape) I am very confident about this because I had 3 and a half months to make sure this was the one. As this is the most expensive thing I've ever bought. Hope you like your, that this helped and I apologize for grammar and spelling.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price!
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey A. Erickson
Reviews.Content: Pros:-CHEAP!-Dual core power!-Snappy, speedy interface!-Netflix, Amazon Prime, Skifta (DLNA) streaming, NO PROBLEM!-Wireless reception good-Bluetooth connection pretty good-Currently lowest price tablet this size with access to Android app store-Nice look, solid build quality-MicroSD expansion slot-Good audio quality from stereo speakersCons:-Bluetooth stack a little quirky, but stable once connected-HDMI out requires purchase of an attachment-Internal storage 8gb - not a real constraint for me. lots of apps installed.-No USB-Battery life good, but average-not as many accessories made for it, Touchpad and iPad 1 cases fit. Bluetooth devices work-not as thin as iPad 3 or Asus Transformer prime, but still quite mobile and doesn't tire arms-not quad core, but more than adequateBegan researching tablets when the Kindle came out and set the new low for price points. Decided I preferred the 10inch form factor.  Wasn't really sure where a tablet fit in my gadget lifestyle, but felt like there was a need for something more mobile and travel friendly. Didn't want to spend a lot because I know I will want a lightweight laptop for more intense tasks.Evaluated and dismissed Xoom and Galaxy.  Really, really like the Asus 300t and the Prime. Just didn't want to invest that much.  Started searching the sub 300 price point and the Le Pan came up with solid reviews on Amazon.  Originally had the 970 briefly but returned because the single core just couldn't handle the streaming media job that was one of my key uses.The Le Pan II fits the bill perfectly for me.  It's very affordable, especially given the power it has.  The dual core on this device makes it quite snappy. The touch screen is extremely responsive. It has been my constant companion for days.  It is very very usable for note taking with Evernote and a Logitech Bluetooth KB, it does Amazon Prime and Netflix without any jerkiness or blocky video.  Basically, it has more than enough processing power to meet my needs. Wireless performs as well as any laptop or iPad in my house.  The speed of the GUI is as fast or faster than the iPad 1. I don't have an iPad 2 or 3 to compare to.The device is HoneyComb out of the box. Rumors of ICS abound and Le Pan has promised the update, but it hasn't surfaced as yet. Not a deal breaker for me, as the Honeycomb interface is quite usable and tablet oriented apps are emerging, so it's not just big goofy phone resolution.One thing I would like to see fixed on it with ICS is the Bluetooth stack.  It could be just the Logitech KB I am using, but I have a connection issue.  Basically, I have to completely reboot the tablet to get it to connect.  When the device times out to save power or I turn the screen off, I can re-connect, but it won't stay connected. I don't have to re-pair, but I have to reboot.  It seems as though the KB is waiting for a response that the tablet only gives the first time they connect after a reboot.  Could be the KB too for that matter. At any rate, works just fine as long as I reboot.  As long as I keep using it periodically, as I do when I take notes at work throughout the day.  It works fine.Battery power is good, not great.  It will last around 8-9 hours using Bluetooth and wireless, but just barely.  It's a good idea to keep your very lightweight Le Pan plug handy.  Yes, it's a 30 pin proprietary job, but it works fine and they do have an HDMI out attachment you can buy.  I don't have much interest in that though.Note about the 9.7 inch form factor.  I have liked the 9.7 size since the iPad. It feels a touch more comfortable to me than the 10.1.  Be advised that widescreen video tends to look better on the 10.1 or even on an iPad since video is often formatted to that device.  That said, I have NO issue watching movies on my Le Pan.  I don't mind letterbox look, MX Player let's me play with how much I fill the screen. Most streaming video uses the screen real estate well, and finally I can format any mobile video to fit the screen perfectly as I see fit. Generally I just format for iPad using Handbrake and it looks great.I use a Logitech Bluetooth KB for Android devices with this tablet. I use the Blurex Leather Folio case made for the Le Pan I and II. I like both.Bottom Line:  Very powerful tablet for a very low price. While I haven't had it long, I think the build quality is excellent and will hold up. If things break down, I will definitely update my review.  I have recommended to several friends. I love this tablet!

Reviews.Title: Ok...not great, not bad... Definitely getting what you paid for.
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: It's Ok..Not great (Or good), not bad either.  But at this price one can't complain either.Issues I have: Rotate sensor is horrible (I constantly have to go to settings to reset the rotate option to auto-rotate screen), WI-FI connection is not that great, I can't see the images on the screen in sunlight (I guess I might have to buy a screen / glare protector to see if this helps), and I constantly have to reset the device as screen goes blank at times.Primary use: I primarily use this device to read books.  I also used it for online shopping with no problem.Overall:  I would recommend this device to someone on a budget and needs only limited functionality out of this device.

Reviews.Title: good quality yet cheap
Reviews.Author: Greg Mattson
Reviews.Content: When i was going through amazons selection of tablets i found this one to be very cheap compared to other wel known brands. It has everything i want ina tablet, netflix, games, and no monthly payment plan. Also the battery life is really good. The only downsides are it runs on an older android OS but it does support new version of adobe flash. And lastly you need wifi to really wanna have fun, no 3g available for this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Forget about the warranty
Reviews.Author: Tim D.
Reviews.Content: If your power button dies one day, which seems to be the #1 problem with Le Pan tablets, you are yet to see how desperate the company will act in trying to find excuses, even contradicting their own warranty, not to replace your tablet. Talking from my own unfortunate experience.

Reviews.Title: hit or miss...
Reviews.Author: nianena
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great...when it turns on. Ordered the first in April, had it for one week before the intermittent start up issues started.  Tried it for another week thinking it was app that was installed that didn't agree with the tablet. No dice. It wouldn't turn on using the power on button, only if you reset it. Sent it back to amazon and asked for a replacement. The estimated ship date was 8 weeks out, they were on back order. Surprisingly enough we got a new one in about 4 weeks. Well, it took 2 weeks for the issue to recur. At first, the tablet wouldn't turn on unless it was plugged in. We thought the battery was draining too quick. So we kept it turned off and fully charged when not in use. Well after a week of that, not even plugging it in would get it to turn on, only a reset. Now not even the reset will get it to turn on. I'm returning it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: not satisfied
Reviews.Author: myth
Reviews.Content: Wanted to return it but too busy. Just have to learn a lesson not to buy electronics online. It always hang and has a problem on the on and off button. Has to reset it everytime it hangs. Planning to give it away. It sucks.-

Reviews.Title: Maybe I got a bad device? Kept freezing.  Returning immediately!
Reviews.Author: M. S. Javier "hopelessly addicted to books"
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait to get home so I could finally try the Le Pan TC 970 tablet in person. After reading the other reviews here on Amazon and on other places online, I was so excited that I skipped dinner and tested the Le Pan immediately. This would have been my first Android device. I already have a desktop PC, a Macbook, iPhone, the Kindles, but I love those widgets on the home screens of Android running devices. Aside from the relatively low price, I also like the size of the Le Pan compared to the other Android tablets, specifically for pdf files. The ability to comfortably read and annotate pdf files is my main purpose for buying a tablet.Anyway, after configuring with my WiFi, I finally got the Le Pan hooked up to my home network. The thing I noticed, though, was that even though I was two feet from my router, the signal strength icon was at the lowest apex level on the Le Pan. The device also kept disconnecting, so I had to wait for the Le Pan to scan and reconnect to my network, which was very slow and super annoying, of course, but I thought maybe it was just my inexperience with the Android system. I went to the Le Pan website using my Macbook, which was in my room, maybe 50 feet away, to download the user's manual to see if I was doing anything wrong.  The signal strength icon on my Macbook was at full strength, even though it's far from the router compared to the Le Pan.  After an hour of connecting/disconnecting, the Le Pan frooze, so I had to get a paper clip to press the reset button.  After resetting, web surfing was still so sluggish.  At this point the battery was almost empty, so I charged it.  While it was charging, it turns out that you could not use the Le Pan.  After reading the manual again, it seems you could NOT use the device during the first charge.  So I went to bed and let it charge overnight, hoping for better performance in the morning.  Again, web surfing was so sluggish!  Also it kept crashing and just totally died - the screen went all black, even though I had laid it down and didn't touch the power button. I thought maybe using apps instead would be easier and faster, but the results were just as bad. I tried logging in to the Facebook and Kindle apps, but got the "failed" and "try again later" messages over and over. When a website did load successfully, the touch screen was frequently inaccurate - it kept opening the link next to the one I wanted to open.  I could not endure any more torture and had to repack it to return the device as soon as the post office reopens after Thanksgiving. I didn't even bother to see if I could use the Le Pan during the succeeding charges or how my pdf files would look on it.I didn't have any problems with the power button as some of the other users. I thought it was odd, though, that there were already bookmarks on the browser when I didn't bookmark any websites. I do agree that the usb end does NOT insert flush with the power adapter, which was weird and emblematic of the cheapness of this product.

Reviews.Title: Spend the extra money for a better brand
Reviews.Author: DebLW
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for a year and a half now, and I regret 'cheaping out' every time I pick the thing up.  The touch screen is sluggish, the response time is slow (and there's nothing wrong with my WiFi) and compared to the resolution of the screens on other tablets out there, it's average at best. One piece of advice - do not, whatever you do - let the battery go below 10% because if it does out entirely, you may never get it started again.  The charger adapter is finicky, and once in a while the tablet will just not start up.  At all. You'll have to find a thumbtack, flip the thing over, and stick it in the "reset" hole on the back of the machine. And even then, you may have to do it more than once. I bought this because I didn't want to spend twice the amount on a higher-end tablet... TRUST me when I say it's worth the extra money. My husband bought me a Samsung Galaxy Tab this past Christmas and there's just no comparison. My kids now use the LePan to play games, and that's it.

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: tootsie girl "jaynet"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a present. After one year exactly almost to the day it stopped working. She called everywhere only to find out it was the battery. Oh and by the way the battery wasn't replaceable. And my bad for not getting extra insurance when I bought it. Who ever heard of a tablet that didn't open for a new battery. She did really like the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Many pros, but heavy cons - my review after 2 year ownership
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mom of 3"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fast little tablet, efficient, great screen, very decent sound, and overall, more than I expected when I bought it...if it wasn't for the BIG con, I would recommend it for anyone...I don't suggest it.CON: from the get go I had an issue that it would randomly not turn on.  About once a week (ever since I got it- 2 years ago), I've had to press the reset button (aka-find a paperclip, back of an earring, a pin, or anything that fits in the tiny reset hole) in order for it to turn on...or, I've had to connect it to the charger for it to turn on.  TODAY, on the two year anniversary of my purchase, the reset button has decided to no longer work and it won't turn on with anything. I've used different chargers, troubleshooted through forums, done everything I can...and when I called them for help, they admitted that there was a hardware problem with this model and that they've been replacing them.  I told them that I've been having issues since I bought it but never sent it in because it was a pretty easy fix.  They pretty much can't do anything because it's been two years and their warranty is for 1 year.  In either case, it doesn't really matter because in all of the forums I've read, people are complaining that the replacements that they were sent are acting up the same way.  In a way, I consider myself lucky because others have had their reset button break much sooner.All in all, if you want to have to be resetting it constantly and eventually end up with a dead tablet, go for it.  Otherwise, just keep looking for another one.  It's really a shame, when it works, it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: too many problems
Reviews.Author: jw
Reviews.Content: I thought that it would be a good buy, but it wasn't.  I would never buy one again, live and learn

Reviews.Title: worst tablet ever!
Reviews.Author: bryan
Reviews.Content: Looks ain't everything or size! Slowest tablets I have ever had or used! The tablet I bought before this for 79.99$ was way faster.

Reviews.Title: Crap, died after a little more than a year of light use.
Reviews.Author: Kaos Soup "stop thinking at me"
Reviews.Content: What can I say? It's dead as a doornail now after 14 months of very light use and zero abuse. I would recommend going with a better name brand based on my experience. 174 bucks...did I get my money's worth? You decide. There's no way that I can see for the consumer to even open this thing up and try the usual resuscitation attempts like removing/replacing the battery.

Reviews.Title: Breaks easily
Reviews.Author: alexd2
Reviews.Content: I bought a total of 6 of these and three have broken. Amazon is great but when you have to return to LePan it gets expensive. Up to $45 if UPS packs. None of the chargers failed. One worked fine and failed to charge. I left one off for 2 months and it will not boot nor will it work using Android recovery. If I had it to do over I would try a different tablet. After the warranty runs out, these are probably throw away. Also part of the repair wipes your stuff and the tablet is returned in new out of box condition (no apps or games).

Reviews.Title: very good tablet
Reviews.Author: MR. Dotsey
Reviews.Content: Forget the iPad, get this its cheap, has a nice build To it, good wifi connection, did I mention It has the Google Play Store. So if you're looking to save money try it out for your self.

Reviews.Title: No WiFi
Reviews.Author: Doesn't Connect
Reviews.Content: I received my LePan II tablet within 3 days after placing the order. However I have not been able to connect to any WiFi service. I had to submit a trouble ticket and it has not yet been resolved. I've had the tablet for 3 weeks and have not been able to use it due to no WiFi connectability.

Reviews.Title: OVER EXCEEDS EXPECTATIONS
Reviews.Author: ShOeBaNdIt
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied! Connected to wifi in a split milisec! Visuals and audio are amazing considering the affordable pricing .... definitely a WOW factor! Actually took the time out of my excitement time with it to do this review! A great PURCHASE!

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: B. Schuh
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my wife. It's easy to use and does everything she needs it to do. My wife isn't the best at using a computer so the Le Pan II is a great tablet for her. She just loves it.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds my expectations....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Leatrice"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Le Pan II for a few months and love it.  I was trying to decide if a Kindle Fire or a Nook would be better for me then I cam across Ernest's review.  I decided to try it out and have been very happy with it.  I have the Kindle and Nook apps downloaded into my Le Pan so this has reinforced my decision to go with the Le Pan II.  I also love that there is an app (free I might add) that is compatible with Microsoft Office (word, pp, excel, etc) which makes it very convenient for me to do school papers when I am not at home.There are so many apps to choose from.  The android technology is very easy to get accustomed to.  I had a set back when trying to download my music, but as long as you use Google Music to sync (can be used with iTunes) and then make sure to mark the music as being accessible offline...all is good.I love that it will accept up to a 32GB memory card which expands the memory capabilities tremendously.  I think the only two things I would add is a camera on the back (in addition to the one on the front) and a USB slot that will accept thumb drives.  I know there is the microSD card slot, but having a thumb drive would make backing up work a little easier when in a rush.I have played Netflix and it is awesomely clear and no lag time.  As long as there is internet available (wifi) the connection and response time are great.  Would also love to see an internet slot meant for mobile internet as well as see Le Pan offer a great monthly internet on the go subscription.  You know, maybe something that is like a wireless air card that could be inserted for anywhere access to internet...maybe the new Le Pan (future) tablets should have two thumb drives...one for memory back up and one for internet access ($10 a month would be awesome...hint, hint).  I would much rather prefer to take and use my Le Pan on the go rather than my laptop computer.I know there will be many tweeks and updates as customers list their likes and don't likes.  I am 100% satisfied with my tablet and don't even think of an iPad or any other tablet now.  This was exactly (and more) what I wanted and will be staying with Le Pan from now on.Thank you for making such a great product and an affordable price.  :D

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Calvin
Reviews.Content: tablet works fine. I have had to reset several times to start up. Support is bad. I could not down load any video sent to me in e-mail from any apple device. No help from support. If you have the same problem, down load vplayer from apps. It will cost you $1.99, then you can down load any video sent to you in all e-mail. The device is fast. Wish it had a back camera but not a big deal. My wife has an ipad2 but she kinda likes my la-pan better.

Reviews.Title: reasonably satisfied
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: Works fairly well, but its no ipad. Occasionally glitches out or gets a little slow. Touch screen is responsive and it works for the basics. For the most part I like it and it has replaced my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II
Reviews.Author: AL
Reviews.Content: Great tablet does everything I wanted it to do and more . Glad I did not spend my money on an ipad . was easy to setup and has good speed , resolution & plenty of downloadable app from the market or online . I am using the case for the hp touchpad and armorshield screen protector . You cannot beat the value you get in a high quality tablet like this . The one drawback is the 30 pin to hdmi for this tablet cannot be found .

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jacque9539
Reviews.Content: This is very much equal to the Ipad at a better price.  I purchased for my mother and I will purchase another for me, it is way cool and so user friendly just awesome!

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Joe G "maclamb"
Reviews.Content: Started with a 7" tablet - but it was too small - and only use fit for movies - not for general purpose work.Then decided to try this tablet (based on reviews)I am so happy I didThe larger size, better screen res and faster responsiveness has made this my main device.my  laptop stay in the office and this goes with me.It is easy to use and read and i find it fun to use just because...

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Fu
Reviews.Content: I truly loved this tablet. The only problem I had was, some of the default apps wouldn't open. Le Pan's tech support was awesome at walking me thru the steps to resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: Short term usage
Reviews.Author: mizque
Reviews.Content: When the notepad is on it is a beautiful thing to work with. But even fully charged  it will keep shuting down for no apparent reason. In an hour it has shut down 5 times. I reboot or restart. At times it will shut down for hrs and will not respond to the power on, restart nothing. Once it decides to turn on it will and then the entire process starts all over agan. Who do I call to report this to? I wish the tablet would stay on long enough to fully enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: B. Evans
Reviews.Content: Waited to order, pondered all the feedbacks but finally ordered it.  Love It!!! Very user friendly, great screen clarity, still learning all it will do. Use it everyday. Great quality.

Reviews.Title: Good for price, but you might want to spend more
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my le pan tablet in December.  At the same time I bought my wife an ipod touch which was priced very similarly.  She uses her ipod touch all the time and I rarely have used my tablet.  The biggest reason is that I can't receive a wifi signal in my living room.  We've never had a problem with any other laptops getting the signal there, and my wife can even take her ipod outside and still receive the signal.  The browser is also considerably slower than the browser of any of our laptops for searching the internet.  Finally today the on/off switch on the tablet broke so that I can no longer turn it on.  I plan to send it back to be fixed, so if that doesn't go well, I may lower the rating.On the plus side, the screen looks very nice.  It is easy to use.  The speakers are very impressive!  After purchasing a 32 GB mini SD card, the tablet has great memory for a great price.  If le pan is easy to work with to get my tablet fixed, I will say it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Worst thing I ever Bought
Reviews.Author: BrandieMae
Reviews.Content: This thing would never work after I recieved it in the mail. Everytime I wanted to play a game or use the internet I would have to reset it and wait for it to load then play the game. I would have to reset it everytime I wanted to use it.

Reviews.Title: What's worse than buying a defective product?
Reviews.Author: VICTORINO
Reviews.Content: My first Lepan froze at least five times the day I got it.  Every day of use it will freeze 2 to 3 times.  Eventually it froze for good.  It won't reset, it won't even turn off.  I waited until the battery died and tried again to no avail.I liked the sleek design and the reasonable price so I gave it another chance. Got another Lepan.  This time I thought I had it figured out.  I thought maybe it was all the applications running in the background that overloads the unit.  I got a couple of apps to take care of this and check running apps every so often.  I was wrong.  The unit froze again. The same ending.  Don't even try getting with their customer "NO" support.  They're probably tired of hearing what they already knew - that they're selling a defective product.  I won't even try the Lepan II.  Don't deal with people who won't stand by their product...they sold you a lemon once, they'll do it again. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Not a media tablet!
Reviews.Author: D. Neth
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet so I could mostly view media (watch videos, listen to music, look at big websites with lots of ads and such) but I was disappointed to discover that it was really slow at doing that. Not dial-up slow, maybe an extra 30 seconds slower than my computer or my iPhone, but the embedded videos were slow and pixelated and not really worth watching. My brother has this same tablet and he mostly plays games on it, which works fine. The specific apps are pretty fast, but the browser is rather slow. And like I said, the poor video quality on embedded videos was a deal-breaker for me. The YouTube app displays videos great, but I don't want to have to click "Watch on Youtube" every time I want to watch a video. So I decided I'm switching to the iPad. It's twice the price, but at least I know what I'll be getting and I know that it works great for viewing media like I want in a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for two months.
Reviews.Author: S. Kauppinen
Reviews.Content: This is a sleek, svelte, sexy piece of steely electro-wizardry, but it gave up the ghost a couple months after I bought it. First the screen began flickering; then it required a full emergency restart to get going; now, nothing brings it back to life. Pretty, but unimpressive. Save up for an iPad...or better still, get off youtube and go outside.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Horrible LePan customer service
Reviews.Author: Geneva Lawson
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet.  It's fantastic and everything that I wanted.  Here's the one problem.  I misplaced my cord for it and since it's a proprietary cord, you have to get it thru LePan.  I started my request by calling on 4/6 and kept getting a recorded message that told me all technicians were busy and to try my call again later...then a hang up.  This went on for a few days.  Finally on 4/12 I speak to a live person that was really not helpful at all and could have cared less either way.  I actually asked him if he thought that was an effiecient way to handle things and he said, "I don't know, I guess not".  Finally I write the request ticket on 4/12.  It is now 4/24 and it still hasn't been mailed.  I paid them on 4/17.  The last explaination I recieved was, "Currently our shipping department is a little backed up. Your order was recently processed and sent to shipping where it awaits shipment. Your patience and cooperation are greatly appreciated."  REALLY????? Is there only 2 people in the entire company??????  Moral of the story, you can have a great product but if you don't have the customer service to back it, you won't have customers for long!  Don't buy this due to costomer service issues, buy another more well known brand that will have better customer service and more readily available parts.

Reviews.Title: Died after 2 hour,
Reviews.Author: P. Lovejoy
Reviews.Content: It's browsing was slow, even in the presence of the cable based wireless router with maximum signal.  I only used it about two hours.  In that time, it froze four times, and then simply went dead even though it was charging and the battery was at forty-three percent. It could not be turned on and reset had no effect.

Reviews.Title: Horrible porduct
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: I recived this product by 3/15/2012.  This product stopped working on 3/20/2012, while  I was  Pandora radio the screen went out and it sounds if it is on making a humming/static noise.  However you can not turn the product back on.  It is a horrible product.  I have spoken with people I work with who have also purchased tablets from Amazon and have had the same exact problem and she returned one and got another one which had the same exact problem with in a week.  I am not sure if it is the problem with the product or with Amazon's distrubution because another friend of mine purchased the same exact product on HSN.com and has not had an issue with it yet!!!!!!  I do not believe I will be shopping off amazon anyu longer

Reviews.Title: Arrived with a defective charger
Reviews.Author: MC17
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet from another retailer so if I had any issues, I could return it directly to their store. (Sorry Amazon).  When it arrived, I used it for a short time to make sure it worked & connected to the internet, as I had read about the wifi issues.  I found screen sizing issues on one of the websites I used & also had one hang up.  I then put it on the charger & let it charge overnight.  The next morning I turned it on, it stayed on for a second & then went dead.  I tried calling Le Pan but got a recorded message, so I emailed their customer service department (it was a Saturday) and didn't receive a response until the following Wednesday.  Didn't matter since I had returned it that Saturday & replaced it with a well known brand with a slightly smaller 8.9 screen.  I paid $70 more than the Le Pan, but it's worth every penny to me.  Oh by the way, the retailer I bought the Le Pan from no longer has them listed on their website.

Reviews.Title: Don't Believe The Hype
Reviews.Author: Vivian M. Reed
Reviews.Content: Le Pan II 9.7 inch tablet pc with 8 GB flash, available to upgrade to Android 4.0.4 I purchased the le pan II after reading the reviews on Amazon as well as researching it on line. I am currently an owner of an Ipad which I truly enjoy. I was looking for something less exspensive for my husbands birthday.  The majority of the reviews were very positive, I was a little hesitant, but also excited because of all of the features described.  Out of the box it looked and felt great, but soon after that, I realized it "ain't no Ipad".  It would have a full battery, and 100% wifi signal, but would say no signal.  It would be fully charged, but would not come on. I had to reset it weekly.  I would use my Ipad at the same time as my husband attempted to use the le pan, but he wouldn't be able to get a signal, or it just wouldn't turn on at all. We use the pads to surf the internet and read email mostly. The le pan performes poorly at these simple task.  I was very disappointed, and upset with myself for wasting my money. I should have saved it and purchased the Ipad.  I could not in good conscious recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Danny Parker
Reviews.Content: This product is not worth spending your money on.  I ordered one last year. It started messing up in about 6 mos., but kept it and gave it the benefit of the doubt. It continuously got worse, and just shut down completely. Got in touch with LePan and they did replace it, but it was right at the year mark. The new one I received started messing up immediately. Screen would freeze and I would have to reset it. It got to the point that I would have to restart it 6-8 times within an hour. It then started to show horizontal colored lines, but nothing else. It would not turn on without resetting it. After this, it would not turn on without it being plugged in and resetting it. Final straw was 2 nites ago when it did not respond to anything. LePan has told me that my warranty with them did not extend just because they sent me a new tablet and they would charge $100.00+ to ship & fix it. This does not say much for their company or their product. I will not order anything else that has their name on it.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE...SCREEN VANISHES AFTER A COUPLE OF MONTHS ON THIS TABLET!
Reviews.Author: Ms.Happy
Reviews.Content: AT FIRST, I WAS SO EXCITED GOT A BIG SIZE TABLET FOR A GOOD PRICE..MY HUSBAND WARNED ME BUT I DIDN'T LISTEN, JUST LOOKING AT THE GOOD PRICE IT WAS..SO LIKE A CHEAPY I BOUGHT IT!! NOW, I HAVE A NEW UN USED LEPAN TC970 MODEL ANDROID OS,PAID GOOD MONEY, IF U READ BLOGS ACROSS THE INTERNET ALL THESE TABLETS DO.. IS WORK FOR ABT 1 MONTH AND THEN YOU GET BLANK SCREEN WITH A CHARGING BATTERY SYMBOL!!WHEN U TRY TO CHARGE AND FIND OUT WHY SCREEN ISN'T APPEARING, ,,NOTHING!I AM ONLY WRITING ABOUT THIS BECAUSE I AM TRYING TO SAVE YOU FROM LOSING GOOD MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT.THE CUSTOMER SERVICE TRY AND RESPOND TO YOU QUICKLY BUT THEY KNOW GOOD AND WELL THAT THESE ARE ALL DEFECTIVE AND THEY HAVE PROMBLEMS.I HAD THE PRODUCT I MONTH ,THEN SCREEN WOULDN'T SHOW SO OF COURSE I SEND IT BACK FOR THEM TO FIX IT...THEY SEND ME OUT ANOTHER TABLET BECAUSE UNDER WARRANTY OF COURSE.. AND AGAIN 2MTS LATER THE SAME THING NO SCREEN ALL OF A SUDDEN,,SO NOW I'M SEARCHING THE INTERNET ABT THE TABLET AND OTHER PEOPLE ARE EXPERIENCING THE SAME THING [...] SO I CALL BACK AND TELL THEM LOOK IT'S COMING BACK TO YOU AND I NEED TO GET ONE THAT ISN'T DEFECTED, THEY SAID SEND IT BACK WE WILL PAY FOR SHIPMENT..I'M LIKE WILL DO..SENT IT BACK AND THEY SAID ..WE GOT YOUR TABLET BUT U HAVE A SMALL CRACK ON THE SCREEN SO YOUR WARRANTY IS NO GOOD BECAUSE THE SCREEN IS CRACKED!I WAS LIKE.. YOU HAVE GOT TO BE KIDDIN ME ..IT WASN'T CRACKED WHEN I SHIPPED IT TO YOU WTH...SO THE SCAMS SENT IT BACK..AND NOT ONLY WAS THE SCREEN CRACKED IT WAS MISSING THE POWER BUTTON NOW,,,SO THEY REALLY MESSED IT UP NOW.. BECAUSE THEY DISMANTLED IT AND TOOK THE POWER BUTTON OUT TO SEE WHAT'S WRONG I GUESS.. PLUS NOW ..THEY SAY OH WE DON'T DO ANY REPAIRS TO THE TABLETS AT THIS TIME YOU NEED TO FIND SOMEONE TO FIX SMALL CRACK ON THE GLASS AND THEN WE CAN SEND U BACK A NEW ONE AGAIN BECAUSE YOU WILL STILL BE UNDER WARRANTY.. BECAUSE NOW THEY BLAMED ME FOR THE CRACK!THE COST TO FIND A NON-BRAND NAME LEPAN GLASS SCREEN IS WORTHLESS TO TABLET FIXERS IN MY AREA.. HAD TO PAY SAME AMOUNT OF THE TABLET TO FIX THE SCREEN,,I MIGHT AS WELL GET A NEW ONE..LONG STORY SHORT COULDN'T FIND SOMEONE TO FIX SCREEN ON TABLET AND THEY --->(MIKE IN CUSTOMER SERVICE WITH ACCENT)CLAIM THEY DIDN'T AND WOULDN'T TAKE OFF A POWER RESET BUTTON AND SEND IT BACK,,SO NOW I'M A LIAR AND HAVE A BRAND NEW LEPAN TABLET,,OH SORRY DEFECTED LEPAN TABLET.. $300 DOLLARS GONE DOWN DRAIN SITTING HERE WITH NO SCREEN AND NO ONE CAN FIX IT HERE IN DALLAS,TX...AGAIN SHOULDN'T HAD STOPPED WORKING TWICE FOR ME TO BE IN THIS SITUATION IN THE FIRST PLACE!!THIS COMPANY CUSTOMER SERVICE SEEMS TO BE RAN BY NO MORE THAN 3 PEOPLE,,BEWARE,,,BEWARE,,,BEWARE SAVE YOUR GOOD MONEY AND GET A GOOD BRAND NAME TABLET...IT'S CHEAP FOR A REASON!!!

Reviews.Title: WARNING: STAY AWAY!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Oganesyan "White Devil Productions"
Reviews.Content: 1) Within a week of purchasing this brand new tablet from Amazon, the back metallic writing started to feel off that says the irresponsible company name2) Within 6 months the touch screen completely stopped working. It absolutely does nothing. Can't turn off, can't operate, its completely dead. Found a reset button in the back, tried that several times and after turning off and back on, it comes to the lock screen but still no fix.3) Thought i'd call these thieves and make them honor their 1 year warranty. Automated system said to speak with a representative it's an approximately a 35 minute hold. I'm thinking greattttttt. As of this exact moment while typing this review, i've been on hold for 2 hours and 2 minutes. No one has cared to answer.PAY THE EXTRA MONEY AND GET AN iPAD OR EVEN A USED iPAD 1 for $150. THE ENTIRE QUALITY OF THE iPAD IS WORTH 10 times more than this pixelateted low resolution PIECE OF S***.

Reviews.Title: 3 weeks and still going strong ......
Reviews.Author: Y. Lee "Ultimate GEEK"
Reviews.Content: I am a techie and I am impressed.  Price is right, great screen size and resolution, nice design, performance is good. I am able to watch Netfix and You Tube - no problem.  Downloaded a ton of games for the kids and surf the net with no issues.Only once, after an overnight charge it would not power on. Wrote to Le Pan and got a reply within an hour with 4 options to try. I already did two of them and moved onto using the reset on the back.  Followed their directions and it came back with out lossing anything.  Am planning for the Droid ICS upgrade.Only rated this as 4 of 5 stars because I only had it for 3.5 weeks.I would recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Nice product.Bit heavier than I thought it would be.
Reviews.Author: Harry Pene
Reviews.Content: Good product.Drop Box didnt work but turned on and off machine than began to work so no problems yet.Havent had much time with it but it is definitely a good purchase

Reviews.Title: weak
Reviews.Author: dody
Reviews.Content: this product sucks half the time it wont charge and if it does it takes like 8 hours and not only that but always freezes or shuts off and stays on the tittle screen or just keeps restarting. pile of garbage stay away

Reviews.Title: Sluggish
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Herrmann
Reviews.Content: Nice looking device which I so wanted to work well, but it turns out to be another tab with inconsistent wifi bandwith and sluggish web browsing, which is my primary use.  Download speeds would range from less than .5 mbps to 15 mbps and latency went from a best of 73 ms to 323 ms.  Just too slow loading web pages and unresponsive.

Reviews.Title: For email and basic browsing maybe...
Reviews.Author: K. Seleen
Reviews.Content: First I must say the build quality is impressive as others have noted. It seems many reviewers are first time tablet users, so I also feel it's important to mention that I am tech savvy, and I have used a wide variety of tablets and smartphones.The Le Pan had intriguing specs and good reviews and is at a price point that android tablets will be most competitive against the ipad elite. But, I'll boil this down...1) It is good for what you pay - great screen, nice looking body, easily handles gmail and simple web browsing... Does well with angry birds and the like... But nothing more video-intensive2) LAG - video playback is a struggle, simply moving around in android has noticeable delay at times - just sliding around using multitouch has a distinct lag compared to my touchpad and direct comparisons of youtube and flash playback were very blocky and disappointing3) Support - several reviewers stated positive comments about le pan support... Le Pan was completely unresponsive to all 5 of my emails with simple questions when I was deciding whether or not to buy and no one was available to answer the phone the 6-7 different times I called over a 3 week period. I am not at all impressed.4) I returned the TC 970, it's just not up to par. The Le Pan II has impressive specs and could potentially perform nearly as well as my touchpad, but the total unresponsiveness of the company would keep me from buying.  Even though the HP touchpad is defunct, you can still always reach a support person.

Reviews.Title: Bad product
Reviews.Author: ifemi "Book Brain"
Reviews.Content: This product need to be pull off the site. The storage is small and it doesn't work some of the time. This made-in-china product is one of the ones we can do better here.

Reviews.Title: very nice unit
Reviews.Author: D. Serio
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. My sister just bought an ipad; we compared the two and decided that the lepan was a much better value. Would recommend the lepan 100%

Reviews.Title: I Must've Received a Lemon
Reviews.Author: Pen Lover WritersEdge com "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Thursday, August 30 2012 - 08:54 AM - UPDATE: Amazon shipped my new LePad and this time the charger works flawlessly. Amazon has been FANTASTIC to work with which is why they are ALWAYS my first stop to buy anything online.  I with I could say the same for the folks who  make LePad - The directions say that once I plug my LePad into the USB port on my computer it will show up as a drive. Well, it doesn't and never has. It runs some installation program which LePad just says to accept automatically and the LePad will show up as a drive but that never happens. There isn't a CD/DVD in the LePad box with the drivers and when I go out to the LePad website it takes a long time to find any download and then when you find it, its not the drivers, its a bunch of games and legacy junk in huge zip files that doesn't do squat to help me connect to my computer so I can begin transferring all my music, pdf's, and gigs of stuff over to my LePad so I can use it forever!  I am going to try and call LePad and see if they will take their phone off "busy signals" long enough to help me. If they don't help get this beast connected to my pc, I will return it and buy a KINDLE FIRE and be done with it!Friday, August 24 2012 - 07:43 AM - I have my LePan for about 3 days.  First, before you judge this Le Pan too harshly understand that mine was problematic right from the start yet Amazon is in the process of sending me a brand new one. I don't believe the one I originally received was "new". I noticed this from the second I opened the box; you just "know" this was purchased and used by someone else and returned because of the way the box has been "repackaged". First the DVD/CD was not in the box so I was never able to sync the Le Pan with my PC. I tried downloading the drivers yet they were HUGE, in a zip file and did not contain an .exe or startup file. Also when you read the "fine print" and "legal disclaimers" you are terrified if you proceed forward to sync the Le Pan with your computer. It was my understanding that as soon as I connected my LePan, via USA to my computer, it would show up as a disk named "LePan" and "BINGO" you are off and xferring file.  Also, this system did not hold a charge while it was playing. Example: plugged in to wall and should be trickle charging while playing and it's actually telling me that it's not even plugged in! Then I turned it completely off to charge and it went from 10% to 17% and automatically turned back on; even after I told it to "shut down" and not "sleep".  It's possessed I tell you. "Carolann - don't look into the light".  I will be reporting back once I receive my new one as I am confident this was a good purchase. You don't constantly get 4+ stars if you a piece of junk.  I remain hopeful.  "I'll Be Back".UPDATE: Friday, August 24 2012 - 10:40 PM = Thankfully Amazon is shipping my new La Pan and I am praying to the computer Gods that this one works. This existing unit has been charging for a good 34 hours and is only at 26% so there are additional issues here. Also my NFL APP freezes and no longer runs on this unit so I'm sans football on this unit which is one of main reason I bought it; although it's only preseason.  I'd really like to stay with the Android O/S yet if this new one that is coming isn't flawless, I might have to wait for a tablet PC which just runs the MicroSoft Windows 8. This is frustrating when Apple seems to be the only Tablet that works yet is so expensive and my entire business software is set up for PC's.

Reviews.Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
Reviews.Author: L. GAINES-MONTGOMERY "G-M"
Reviews.Content: PLEASE!PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE I DID!I AM AN ADROID LOVER AND WHEN I FOUND THIS TABLET I COMPARED ITS SPECS TO OTHER DROID TABLETS AND THE IPAD. I DECIDED TO PURCHASE IT AFTER READING ALL OF THE REVIEWS AND THE SPECS BASED ON THE PRICE. I PURCHASED THIS TABLET IN DECEMBER OF 2011 AND IT WORKED WELL FROM WHAT I COULD SEE AT THE ONSET OF USING IT. THEN AROUND FEBRUARY 2012 THE POWER BUTTON WOULD NOT WORK SO WHEN THE SCREENSAVER CAME ON I WOULD HAVE TO RESET IT. THEN THE RESET BUTTON STOPPED WORKING. I TRIED TO CALL LEPAN SUPPORT AND NEVER WAS ABLE TO REACH ANYONE BESIDES THE VOICEMAIL AND THEY NEVER RETURNED MY CALL. I ENDED UP SENDING LEPAN SUPPORT AN EMAIL AND POSTING A COMPLAINT ON MY SUPPORT VIA THE WEBSITE.  THEY SAID THAT THEY WERE CREATING AN RMA NUMBER AND TO SHIP IT BACK TO THEM BUYER COST (AT MY COST ON TOP OF THE INCONVENIENCE). I NEVER GOT A STATUS UPDATE FROM THEM, I ALWAYS HAD TO EMAIL THEM AND THEY SAID 2-3 WEEKS.  I SENT THE TABLET VIA PRIORITY MAIL WITH A SIGNATURE AND I KNOW THEY RECEIVED THE TABLET March 26, 2012 TODAY IS SUNDAY APRIL 22,2012 AND I HAVE YET TO GET AN UPDATE ABOUT THE TABLET! I HAVE REQUESTED A REFUND OR A NEW TABLET. I AM CURRENTLY LOOKING INTO MY LEGAL RIGHTS AS FAR AS GETTING ALL OF MY MONEY BACK INCLUDING THE MONEY FOR SHIPPING AND SIGNATURE CONFIRMATION. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY JUST GO TO APPLE AND BUY A 16GB IPAD2 FOR 399 BECAUSE ATLEAST IF SOMETHING GOES WRONG WITH IT YOU WILL HAVE PROMPT AND COURTEOUS SERVICE AND NOT THIS CIRCUS OF A COMPANY WALKING AWAY WITH ALMOST $300 FOR A KNOCK OFF!IF YOU BUY IT DON'T SAY YOU WEREN'T WARNED!

Reviews.Title: The star is for Amazon
Reviews.Author: jwf
Reviews.Content: The LePan tablet shows great promise; however, it is not yet ready for prime time. Like several other reviews, the tablet worked fine for a few days, but then started shutting off randomly when web browsing and would not restart without a hard reset.  Also, when it did work, it had problems uploading files to Google Docs (worked fine on my Toshiba Thrive.) The shutoffs kept happening - even after a reformat - and finally bricked the device. Fortunately, it was only day four, so I was able to return it to Amazon immediately as a defective product. I did not attempt to reach customer service, and I did not ask for a new one.The physical feel of the device is nice, but the screen is not the best quality for reading. I enjoy reading on my Thrive, which I bought refurbished for only a few dollars more than the LePan. Bottom line is that if your tablet works, it's a nice entry level tablet for games, web browsing and email... and many android apps. But, I can't fully recommend it for the traveler or power user. Also, LePan's proprietary connector does not have adapters to expand functionality. The one star is for Amazon's easy return process.

Reviews.Title: bad choise
Reviews.Author: cris takeda
Reviews.Content: Yes, I bought it for the price, but it's not worthy! It frozen all the time, and today for nothing it stop to work !DO NOT BUY IT !

Reviews.Title: A dud maybe?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was very excited to get this. It has not been a good experience for us. First concern was it took a LONG time for me to receive this item, even with Amazon prime. But that wouldn't warrant a bad review.  Sadly this tablet continues to freeze and has to be reset every other day or so. It isn't too big of a pain as the reset is fairly simple. Still, it takes a lot of the fun out of it when it freezes so often. We don't even have anything fancy on here, just a couple of basic apps like kindle reader, angry birds and math games. After a month of continual freezing and resetting this now sits on the desk more often than not. Sad.

Reviews.Title: A lovely paperweight.
Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: I would love to write a complete and helpful review of my Le Pan tablet, but I have no idea how functional or user-friendly it is.  We took ours out of the box, fully charged it, and excitedly prepared to use it for ourselves and our toddler.  We tapped the menu button, and the tablet froze.  We tried for several minutes to tap the screen or press the power button and nothing would budge.  Finally we had to use the reset button.  The tablet rebooted, we tapped on another icon...and it froze again.  This went on for about an hour before we discovered a firmware upgrade (you can imagine how slow of a process a firmware upgrade was when the tablet froze after each keystroke).  The upgrade did not resolve the problem so we contacted customer care.  They informed us that the tablet is prone to freezing when the battery life is below 60%, that we should make sure our tablet is fully charged and wait for an upcoming firmware upgrade that would resolve the freezing issue.It has now been over a month since that email exchange and we still have what basically amounts to a $200 paperweight.  No firmware upgrade has surfaced, and we are still unable to use our tablet.  It seems odd to me that Le Pan would put their name on a product that can only function when the battery is fully charged.  This drastically reduce the usability of the tablet.  At this point, that is the only comment I can offer.  Perhaps I received a defective tablet and if Le Pan replaces it I will happily leave a more thorough review.

Reviews.Title: I'M SPEECHLESS!
Reviews.Author: Rex Deguzman "rex"
Reviews.Content: I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO THINK ABOUT THIS PRODUCT.SERIOUSLY, I DIDN'T BELIEVE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS HERE; THAT WAS A STUPID MOVE. I DIDN'T KNOW HOW MANY TIMES I PRESSED THE RESET BUTTON ON THIS TABLET!LOOKS GOOD FROM THE OUTSIDE BUT NEVER JUDGE THE BOOK BY IT'S COVER. LOOKS PRETTY BUT THE WORST TABLET I EVER HAD.SO MUCH ABOUT BEING CHEAP!I DON'T KNOW HOW THESE ITEMS CAN PASS THE QUALITY CONTROL AND HAVE THEM AVAILABLE TO THE PAYING PUBLIC. IS THERE A NEGATIVE STAR RATING????THIS DOESN'T DESERVE A STAR!

Reviews.Title: Tried two, neither worked long.
Reviews.Author: stukatie
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as it seemed a bargain at the price. The tablet worked fine for about 3 weeks and then one day out of the blue it beeped and shut down, after that I couldn't get it to boot up again. I returned the tablet and promptly received a replacement, this one seemed kind of sluggish from the moment we had it. After about a week it stopped working, I powered it on and it just seemed to be forever booting up displaying the Le Pan logo but not going any where.After that I asked Amazon for a refund rather than a replacement. I then spent some extra on the Acer Iconia A500 tablet, that one cost me $395 and I haven't had any issues so far with that tablet.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed with Skype capabilities
Reviews.Author: Bridgette
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these tablets for my neice and nephew so that we could Skype and I could keep in touch with their kids.The picture quality isTERRIBLE! The sound is worse with delay and feedbackThe faces come out looking like there are pixels and it's way too dark even in the brightest sunshineI'm very disappointed, but luckily we can Skype and FaceTime through the iPhones.Has anyone else experienced this?  Help

Reviews.Title: I have a Le Pan II
Reviews.Author: jdbarnhart
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my Le Pan II 9.7 inch tablet until I tried to find a USB port to download new Vipre security software.  Am I missing something, is there an adapter for the Le Pan II with the USB port?  If there isn't a USB port adapter how do I download/upload anything?Thanks,Janet B

Reviews.Title: Amazon Really Dropping the Ball!
Reviews.Author: AK
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet based on reading reviews that it was a decent substitute for some of the more expensive tablets.  Boy was that wrong!  After using the tablet for about 2 weeks, it would no longer power on - totally unresponsive.  I contacted Amazon that I wanted to return it, but there is a problem - I needed to be able to wipe my sensitive info first.  I had several email accounts setup on the tablet and since I can't power it on I have no way of wiping it.  Their answer was - I should "trust them" that when they receive it they will wipe it for me.  I have never heard of anything more ridiculous!  I spoke to a manager and he was no more helpful.  I suggested that I open the device and I remove the hard drive (this way I know my data is safe) however they did not accept my suggestion.  I am going to contact AMEX to dispute and see if they will be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: My worst nightmare!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Peggy M. Kerper
Reviews.Content: This tablet was by far my worst nightmare.  I could not connect to my wireless router.  I called LePan & spent soooo much time trying to reach them & then when I did, they were of no help.  They actually told me that they couldn't stay on the phone with me as they were short handed.  They sent me an email on how they thought I could fix the problem & the email instructions were for someone who needed a degree in working on them.  I am not the smartest person when it comes to computers, but I am also far from the worse. Called Amazon & they sent me another one & had ther same problem with the 2nd one.  I ended up also sending the 2nd one back.  Bought a Toshiba Thrive & have no problems at all with it.  Maybe this product would have been ok, if LePan could have figurd out what the problem was.  LePan has the worst customer service/techinical support I have ever dealt with.  I actually spent about almost 2 days of my time on this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Not an iPad - Unresponsive
Reviews.Author: Jim Tankard
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed at all. It went back to Amazon about 10 minutes after opening the box. Was extremely slow and the touch screen was not as responsive as my iPad and other Android devices. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: I did not like it!
Reviews.Author: OC, CA
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet based on the really good reviews! I waited about 3 weeks to get it.I'm an Android user the last 28 months.The body of this tablet is really a quality one.The screen just as any other tablet is very nice, colors etc.... The negative on the screen is, the finger prints are very annoying ( my hands were clean )Connection to my router was instant and remained excellent.So many application I like not compatible with this unit or the operating system, (amazon, direct tv, brightness app etc.....Updating the system took about 1 hour 20 min on excellent wifi connection.I tried several browsers I like and I have experience with, none of them works as good as they work very well on my smartphone. Some web sites not coming up at all and most of them has sizing issues and the loading seems very slow to me. Watching videos on websites almost impossible. Even youtube is a very bad stop and go. I tried several browsers and 2 networks with good connection.I copied a movie from my laptop it was playing fine but the sound, what a hell? I had to place the tablet 5 inch to my ear to hear something. Maybe it was designed for headphone users but at this point I did not care anymore.I tried all these things for about 10 hours, 2 different networks, several browsers.All these things works fine on my smartphone.If I want to have a bigger screen than my phone, I will definitely will choose netbook. It is frustration free and works well.

Reviews.Title: get what you pay for - UPDATE
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Its cheap for a reason. This is my first android device.First dayLocked up twiceWifi kept not working, even though it said connected, only reboot would fix itPandora and jango skip.. thats when it'd work at allMany games. Like gun bros, dont work (LACK OF RAM, 512meg is just NOT ENOUGH)The touchpad is subpar at best, i find myself mashing the screen constantly to get small buttons to hitI came from an IPhone4, so some of this may be Android's downfall. I didn't like apple until I bought this thing.Its going backUPDATE: 9/17/2011Against my better judgement, I decided to keep the tablet for a bit. I did a factory reset and within minutes it was locking up, slow, apps crashing. Amongst many, many other random problems. Web browsing was a big issue, it would freeze on a regular basis, and forget about hitting the stop button, it just seems to lock up the device. Firefox, Firefox Beta, Opera, and Chrome ALL did this.The thing that REALLY erks me, the RESET button requires a pen to use. I was resetting the tablet a couple times a day so this is just ridiculous.It's really going back this time. I sent in for the refund and buying the Acer Iconia instead. Some of these problems are no doubt part of Android, but with a tablet thats subpar on processor and memory, it makes it unbearable.UPDATE:The Acer Iconia is working out perfectly, no more issues ...

Reviews.Title: Only worth $150 or so
Reviews.Author: Fellow Amazon Fan
Reviews.Content: Le Pan TC 970 9.7-Inch Multi-Touch LCD Google Android Tablet PCI ordered this Le Pan and returned the next day.  The outside is nicely built and I like the design.  But I am new to Android and don't know how to verify the processor speed and the RAM memory like people do on Windows.  I suspect that the processor speed and the RAM memory is not what they claim, particularly the RAM.  I feel it is very slow when switching between applications.  I also believe the video card or video chip inside the pad is slow or of poor quality.  It claims that the resolution is 1024X768, but when I play videos of that size, it is slow and the picture is lagging behind the sound, in other words, I hear the sound first and movement of a person's mouth does not match the sound.  I know you will think that the video may not be good quality, or wrong format.  I can tell you I am an expert on converting videos and I can play the same video with no problem on ViewSonic, although I also returned that one for other reasons:)  Also, when I try to fastforward a movie, it will not fastforward, but pause for some time before getting to the place I want it to play, then, the lagging between the picture and the sound is even worse.  That is why I believe the processor and the video chip speed is not there to support 1024X768.  I was willing to pay for this Le Pan basically because I like the size, the processor speed, and the RAM (claimed to be 512MB).  I bought a cheap 7 inch pad in China (350 Chinese Yuan=$55-60USD) with a slower processor and 256MB RAM, but it played the videos much more smoothly than this Le Pan.  In my opinion it is worth $150 maybe even less than that.  I don't want to buy it unless they improve the hardware or reduce the price.  Also, I forgot to mention that on the upper left corner of the screen there is bleeding white edge when the screen is dark during a movie playing.  Sorry, I cannot say lots of good things about this Le Pan.  Maybe I just had bad luck.I do want to say that I like Amazon.  I filed return and they sent me the UPS return label immediately and gave credit back to my credit card even before they received the return.  Maybe it is because I have been a good customer:) I don't have worries ordering at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Terrible....beware!!!!
Reviews.Author: andrea hilaski
Reviews.Content: By far the worse experience I have had with any consumer product.  I finally received the product only to have it shipped with a dead screen.  Let me put it as simple as possible...What type of company ships electronics with dead screens?  It is probably better that this happened since with the absence of a quality department in the company...who knows what other problems could lurk on such a complex product.  BTW...I tried to contact Le Pan and was told from a recording that the number was busy.03/07 UpdateWell,  in the race to see who is more responsive between Circuit City (the seller via Amazon) or Lepan,  Lepan is winning the race.  They sent me instructions for the return that I am following.  I have not received anything from Circuit City.03/26  UpdateI called LePan this past Friday and it appears that they have received it and are fixing the tablet.  I am a little hesitant though as they have stopped updating the process.  So here I am almost one month and still without a working tablet.04/26  UpdateWell I finally received a tablet.  This was after receiving a notification from Le Pan that I would have to wait in line since they had so many RMA's that they could not possibly tell me when I would receive it.  I finally contacted the Amazon A-Z team(after that update from Lepan).  I am assuming that the A-Z team must have gotten involved, as I was surprised to received the tablet in the mail on Monday of this week.  Now the only issue is that they actually sent me the wrong model and not the tablet II that I had bought and then sent back to them.  It also seems that the Customer Service is more responsive at LePan as they were pretty quick to response that they were sorry for the error and will send me another one and than I can send back this one.  Let's cross my fingersSo in summary....if you feel like dealing with "Peggy" who is located in somewhere (that you will never be able to identify) and have time to deal with emails, phones call to which in turn frustrate the hell out of you and a wife that will remind you of "you get what you pay for"....well buy one of these.  Or you could just entertain yourself by lighting 3 one hundred bills on fire and watching them burn.  Obviously my confidence with this tablet in at the ground floor level and if I have any more problems with this brand,  I will take it out to the driveway and promptly back over it with my car and then go back to the store to buy something else.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: henry
Reviews.Content: heard it was preaty good might buy it can it go on skype ovo stuff like that let me know cuz me and my cuzin might be able to vid chat

Reviews.Title: Pretty Darn Buggy
Reviews.Author: Backcut
Reviews.Content: I am an avid apple user.  I bought the wife an ipad 2 last year.  I have stayed away from anything but apple because of issues like these.  I wanted a tablet to take the place of big binders that I keep music chords/tabs in. I didn't want to pay a lot as this was a luxury for me, not necessity.  I looked at the Le Pan 1 and was pretty much sold until I read that I wouldn't be able to upgrade to the newer Android OS.  I knew that no matter what, it wouldn't be as good as MAC IOS, so I was up sold to the Le Pan 2 so it wouldn't sting as bad.  Im now regretting the purchase away from my beloved brand and the up sale to a inferior product.The tablet is only 2 days old, and it is already showing its issues.  Today the touchscreen wouldn't work for scrolling, only tapping until i did a reboot.  Then again today, I was searching for my home internet when the screen went haywire and was totally unrecognizable for minutes.  I cant wait to see what tomorrow will hold.Also, BEWARE:  If you are planning on using this product with a Mac.  I have searched far and wide for programs to have my mac and the tablet play nice together, it is a long and grueling process that I'm still not sure anything will become of it.  I will update if things get any better for my over priced music notebook.  As of now, I recommend saving your money and buying an ipad.
